module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Category

-- | The skill store category that is shown. Alexa skills are assigned a
--   specific skill category during creation, such as News, Social, and
--   Sports.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCategory</a> smart constructor.
data Category
Category' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Category

-- | The ID of the skill store category.
[$sel:categoryId:Category'] :: Category -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of the skill store category.
[$sel:categoryName:Category'] :: Category -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Category</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:categoryId:Category'</a>, <a>category_categoryId</a> - The ID
--   of the skill store category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:categoryName:Category'</a>, <a>category_categoryName</a> - The
--   name of the skill store category.
newCategory :: Category

-- | The ID of the skill store category.
category_categoryId :: Lens' Category (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the skill store category.
category_categoryName :: Lens' Category (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Category.Category
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Category.Category
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Category.Category

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateInstantBooking

-- | Creates settings for the instant booking feature that are applied to a
--   room profile. When users start their meeting with Alexa, Alexa
--   automatically books the room for the configured duration if the room
--   is available.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateInstantBooking</a> smart constructor.
data CreateInstantBooking
CreateInstantBooking' :: Int -> Bool -> CreateInstantBooking

-- | Duration between 15 and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that
--   determines how long to book an available room when a meeting is
--   started with Alexa.
[$sel:durationInMinutes:CreateInstantBooking'] :: CreateInstantBooking -> Int

-- | Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
[$sel:enabled:CreateInstantBooking'] :: CreateInstantBooking -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateInstantBooking</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInMinutes:CreateInstantBooking'</a>,
--   <a>createInstantBooking_durationInMinutes</a> - Duration between 15
--   and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that determines how long to book
--   an available room when a meeting is started with Alexa.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CreateInstantBooking'</a>,
--   <a>createInstantBooking_enabled</a> - Whether instant booking is
--   enabled or not.
newCreateInstantBooking :: Int -> Bool -> CreateInstantBooking

-- | Duration between 15 and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that
--   determines how long to book an available room when a meeting is
--   started with Alexa.
createInstantBooking_durationInMinutes :: Lens' CreateInstantBooking Int

-- | Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
createInstantBooking_enabled :: Lens' CreateInstantBooking Bool
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateInstantBooking.CreateInstantBooking
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateInstantBooking.CreateInstantBooking
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateInstantBooking.CreateInstantBooking
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateInstantBooking.CreateInstantBooking
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateInstantBooking.CreateInstantBooking
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateInstantBooking.CreateInstantBooking
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateInstantBooking.CreateInstantBooking


module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateRequireCheckIn

-- | Creates settings for the require check in feature that are applied to
--   a room profile. Require check in allows a meeting roomâ€™s Alexa or AVS
--   device to prompt the user to check in; otherwise, the room will be
--   released.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRequireCheckIn</a> smart constructor.
data CreateRequireCheckIn
CreateRequireCheckIn' :: Int -> Bool -> CreateRequireCheckIn

-- | Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the
--   room if it's not checked into.
[$sel:releaseAfterMinutes:CreateRequireCheckIn'] :: CreateRequireCheckIn -> Int

-- | Whether require check in is enabled or not.
[$sel:enabled:CreateRequireCheckIn'] :: CreateRequireCheckIn -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateRequireCheckIn</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseAfterMinutes:CreateRequireCheckIn'</a>,
--   <a>createRequireCheckIn_releaseAfterMinutes</a> - Duration between 5
--   and 20 minutes to determine when to release the room if it's not
--   checked into.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CreateRequireCheckIn'</a>,
--   <a>createRequireCheckIn_enabled</a> - Whether require check in is
--   enabled or not.
newCreateRequireCheckIn :: Int -> Bool -> CreateRequireCheckIn

-- | Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the
--   room if it's not checked into.
createRequireCheckIn_releaseAfterMinutes :: Lens' CreateRequireCheckIn Int

-- | Whether require check in is enabled or not.
createRequireCheckIn_enabled :: Lens' CreateRequireCheckIn Bool
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateRequireCheckIn.CreateRequireCheckIn
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateRequireCheckIn.CreateRequireCheckIn

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.EndOfMeetingReminder

-- | Settings for the end of meeting reminder feature that are applied to a
--   room profile. The end of meeting reminder enables Alexa to remind
--   users when a meeting is ending.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndOfMeetingReminder</a> smart constructor.
data EndOfMeetingReminder
EndOfMeetingReminder' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Int) -> Maybe EndOfMeetingReminderType -> Maybe Bool -> EndOfMeetingReminder

-- | A range of 3 to 15 minutes that determines when the reminder begins.
[$sel:reminderAtMinutes:EndOfMeetingReminder'] :: EndOfMeetingReminder -> Maybe (NonEmpty Int)

-- | The type of sound that users hear during the end of meeting reminder.
[$sel:reminderType:EndOfMeetingReminder'] :: EndOfMeetingReminder -> Maybe EndOfMeetingReminderType

-- | Whether an end of meeting reminder is enabled or not.
[$sel:enabled:EndOfMeetingReminder'] :: EndOfMeetingReminder -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>EndOfMeetingReminder</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reminderAtMinutes:EndOfMeetingReminder'</a>,
--   <a>endOfMeetingReminder_reminderAtMinutes</a> - A range of 3 to 15
--   minutes that determines when the reminder begins.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reminderType:EndOfMeetingReminder'</a>,
--   <a>endOfMeetingReminder_reminderType</a> - The type of sound that
--   users hear during the end of meeting reminder.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EndOfMeetingReminder'</a>,
--   <a>endOfMeetingReminder_enabled</a> - Whether an end of meeting
--   reminder is enabled or not.
newEndOfMeetingReminder :: EndOfMeetingReminder

-- | A range of 3 to 15 minutes that determines when the reminder begins.
endOfMeetingReminder_reminderAtMinutes :: Lens' EndOfMeetingReminder (Maybe (NonEmpty Int))

-- | The type of sound that users hear during the end of meeting reminder.
endOfMeetingReminder_reminderType :: Lens' EndOfMeetingReminder (Maybe EndOfMeetingReminderType)

-- | Whether an end of meeting reminder is enabled or not.
endOfMeetingReminder_enabled :: Lens' EndOfMeetingReminder (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.EndOfMeetingReminder.EndOfMeetingReminder
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.EndOfMeetingReminder.EndOfMeetingReminder
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.EndOfMeetingReminder.EndOfMeetingReminder
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.EndOfMeetingReminder.EndOfMeetingReminder
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.EndOfMeetingReminder.EndOfMeetingReminder
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.EndOfMeetingReminder.EndOfMeetingReminder
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.EndOfMeetingReminder.EndOfMeetingReminder

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | Creates meeting room settings of a room profile.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateMeetingRoomConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration
CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe CreateEndOfMeetingReminder -> Maybe CreateInstantBooking -> Maybe CreateRequireCheckIn -> CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
[$sel:roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'] :: CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:endOfMeetingReminder:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'] :: CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe CreateEndOfMeetingReminder

-- | Settings to automatically book a room for a configured duration if
--   it's free when joining a meeting with Alexa.
[$sel:instantBooking:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'] :: CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe CreateInstantBooking

-- | Settings for requiring a check in when a room is reserved. Alexa can
--   cancel a room reservation if it's not checked into to make the room
--   available for others. Users can check in by joining the meeting with
--   Alexa or an AVS device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
[$sel:requireCheckIn:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'] :: CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe CreateRequireCheckIn

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createMeetingRoomConfiguration_roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled</a> -
--   Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOfMeetingReminder:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createMeetingRoomConfiguration_endOfMeetingReminder</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instantBooking:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createMeetingRoomConfiguration_instantBooking</a> - Settings to
--   automatically book a room for a configured duration if it's free when
--   joining a meeting with Alexa.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireCheckIn:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createMeetingRoomConfiguration_requireCheckIn</a> - Settings for
--   requiring a check in when a room is reserved. Alexa can cancel a room
--   reservation if it's not checked into to make the room available for
--   others. Users can check in by joining the meeting with Alexa or an AVS
--   device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
newCreateMeetingRoomConfiguration :: CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
createMeetingRoomConfiguration_roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled :: Lens' CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
createMeetingRoomConfiguration_endOfMeetingReminder :: Lens' CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration (Maybe CreateEndOfMeetingReminder)

-- | Settings to automatically book a room for a configured duration if
--   it's free when joining a meeting with Alexa.
createMeetingRoomConfiguration_instantBooking :: Lens' CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration (Maybe CreateInstantBooking)

-- | Settings for requiring a check in when a room is reserved. Alexa can
--   cancel a room reservation if it's not checked into to make the room
--   available for others. Users can check in by joining the meeting with
--   Alexa or an AVS device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
createMeetingRoomConfiguration_requireCheckIn :: Lens' CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration (Maybe CreateRequireCheckIn)

[$sel:feature:DeviceStatusDetail'] :: DeviceStatusDetail -> Maybe Feature

--   <a>deviceStatusDetail_feature</a> - The list of available features on
--   the device.

-- | The list of available features on the device.

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.DeviceStatusInfo

-- | Detailed information about a device's status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeviceStatusInfo</a> smart constructor.
data DeviceStatusInfo
DeviceStatusInfo' :: Maybe [DeviceStatusDetail] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ConnectionStatus -> DeviceStatusInfo

-- | One or more device status detail descriptions.
[$sel:deviceStatusDetails:DeviceStatusInfo'] :: DeviceStatusInfo -> Maybe [DeviceStatusDetail]

-- | The time (in epoch) when the device connection status changed.
[$sel:connectionStatusUpdatedTime:DeviceStatusInfo'] :: DeviceStatusInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The latest available information about the connection status of a
--   device.
[$sel:connectionStatus:DeviceStatusInfo'] :: DeviceStatusInfo -> Maybe ConnectionStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>DeviceStatusInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceStatusDetails:DeviceStatusInfo'</a>,
--   <a>deviceStatusInfo_deviceStatusDetails</a> - One or more device
--   status detail descriptions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionStatusUpdatedTime:DeviceStatusInfo'</a>,
--   <a>deviceStatusInfo_connectionStatusUpdatedTime</a> - The time (in
--   epoch) when the device connection status changed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionStatus:DeviceStatusInfo'</a>,
--   <a>deviceStatusInfo_connectionStatus</a> - The latest available
--   information about the connection status of a device.
newDeviceStatusInfo :: DeviceStatusInfo

-- | One or more device status detail descriptions.
deviceStatusInfo_deviceStatusDetails :: Lens' DeviceStatusInfo (Maybe [DeviceStatusDetail])

-- | The time (in epoch) when the device connection status changed.
deviceStatusInfo_connectionStatusUpdatedTime :: Lens' DeviceStatusInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The latest available information about the connection status of a
--   device.
deviceStatusInfo_connectionStatus :: Lens' DeviceStatusInfo (Maybe ConnectionStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.DeviceStatusInfo.DeviceStatusInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.DeviceStatusInfo.DeviceStatusInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.DeviceStatusInfo.DeviceStatusInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.DeviceStatusInfo.DeviceStatusInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.DeviceStatusInfo.DeviceStatusInfo

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.DeviceData

-- | Device attributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeviceData</a> smart constructor.
data DeviceData
DeviceData' :: Maybe DeviceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeviceStatusInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DeviceData

-- | The status of a device.
[$sel:deviceStatus:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe DeviceStatus

-- | The MAC address of a device.
[$sel:macAddress:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | The time (in epoch) when the device data was created.
[$sel:createdTime:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of a device.
[$sel:deviceArn:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileName:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about a device's status.
[$sel:deviceStatusInfo:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe DeviceStatusInfo

-- | The room ARN associated with a device.
[$sel:roomArn:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of a device.
[$sel:deviceName:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | The serial number of a device.
[$sel:deviceSerialNumber:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of a device.
[$sel:deviceType:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the room associated with a device.
[$sel:roomName:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileArn:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | The software version of a device.
[$sel:softwareVersion:DeviceData'] :: DeviceData -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeviceData</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceStatus:DeviceData'</a>, <a>deviceData_deviceStatus</a> -
--   The status of a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:macAddress:DeviceData'</a>, <a>deviceData_macAddress</a> - The
--   MAC address of a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:DeviceData'</a>, <a>deviceData_createdTime</a> -
--   The time (in epoch) when the device data was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceArn:DeviceData'</a>, <a>deviceData_deviceArn</a> - The
--   ARN of a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileName:DeviceData'</a>,
--   <a>deviceData_networkProfileName</a> - The name of the network profile
--   associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceStatusInfo:DeviceData'</a>,
--   <a>deviceData_deviceStatusInfo</a> - Detailed information about a
--   device's status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomArn:DeviceData'</a>, <a>deviceData_roomArn</a> - The room
--   ARN associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceName:DeviceData'</a>, <a>deviceData_deviceName</a> - The
--   name of a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceSerialNumber:DeviceData'</a>,
--   <a>deviceData_deviceSerialNumber</a> - The serial number of a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceType:DeviceData'</a>, <a>deviceData_deviceType</a> - The
--   type of a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomName:DeviceData'</a>, <a>deviceData_roomName</a> - The
--   name of the room associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileArn:DeviceData'</a>,
--   <a>deviceData_networkProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the network profile
--   associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:softwareVersion:DeviceData'</a>,
--   <a>deviceData_softwareVersion</a> - The software version of a device.

deviceData_networkProfileName :: Lens' DeviceData (Maybe Text)

-- | Detailed information about a device's status.

-- | The room ARN associated with a device.

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Device

-- | A device with attributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDevice</a> smart constructor.
data Device
Device' :: Maybe DeviceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeviceStatusInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeviceNetworkProfileInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Device

-- | The status of a device. If the status is not READY, check the
--   DeviceStatusInfo value for details.
[$sel:deviceStatus:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe DeviceStatus

-- | The MAC address of a device.
[$sel:macAddress:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of a device.
[$sel:deviceArn:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about a device's status.
[$sel:deviceStatusInfo:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe DeviceStatusInfo

-- | The room ARN of a device.
[$sel:roomArn:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of a device.
[$sel:deviceName:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe Text

-- | The serial number of a device.
[$sel:deviceSerialNumber:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.
[$sel:networkProfileInfo:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe DeviceNetworkProfileInfo

-- | The type of a device.
[$sel:deviceType:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe Text

-- | The software version of a device.
[$sel:softwareVersion:Device'] :: Device -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Device</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceStatus:Device'</a>, <a>device_deviceStatus</a> - The
--   status of a device. If the status is not READY, check the
--   DeviceStatusInfo value for details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:macAddress:Device'</a>, <a>device_macAddress</a> - The MAC
--   address of a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceArn:Device'</a>, <a>device_deviceArn</a> - The ARN of a
--   device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceStatusInfo:Device'</a>, <a>device_deviceStatusInfo</a> -
--   Detailed information about a device's status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomArn:Device'</a>, <a>device_roomArn</a> - The room ARN of a
--   device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceName:Device'</a>, <a>device_deviceName</a> - The name of
--   a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceSerialNumber:Device'</a>,
--   <a>device_deviceSerialNumber</a> - The serial number of a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileInfo:Device'</a>,
--   <a>device_networkProfileInfo</a> - Detailed information about a
--   device's network profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceType:Device'</a>, <a>device_deviceType</a> - The type of
--   a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:softwareVersion:Device'</a>, <a>device_softwareVersion</a> -
--   The software version of a device.
newDevice :: Device

-- | The status of a device. If the status is not READY, check the
--   DeviceStatusInfo value for details.
device_deviceStatus :: Lens' Device (Maybe DeviceStatus)

-- | The ARN of a device.

-- | Detailed information about a device's status.
device_deviceStatusInfo :: Lens' Device (Maybe DeviceStatusInfo)

-- | The room ARN of a device.
device_roomArn :: Lens' Device (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a device.

-- | The serial number of a device.
device_deviceSerialNumber :: Lens' Device (Maybe Text)

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.

device_softwareVersion :: Lens' Device (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Filter

-- | A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific
--   list of results. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by
--   various criteria.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilter</a> smart constructor.
data Filter
Filter' :: Text -> [Text] -> Filter

-- | The key of a filter.
[$sel:key:Filter'] :: Filter -> Text

-- | The values of a filter.
[$sel:values:Filter'] :: Filter -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Filter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_key</a> - The key of a filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_values</a> - The values of a
--   filter.
newFilter :: Text -> Filter

-- | The key of a filter.
filter_key :: Lens' Filter Text

-- | The values of a filter.
filter_values :: Lens' Filter [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Filter.Filter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Filter.Filter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Filter.Filter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Filter.Filter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Filter.Filter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Filter.Filter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Filter.Filter


module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Gateway

-- | The details of the gateway.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGateway</a> smart constructor.
data Gateway
Gateway' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Gateway

-- | The ARN of the gateway.
[$sel:arn:Gateway'] :: Gateway -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the gateway group that the gateway is associated to.
[$sel:gatewayGroupArn:Gateway'] :: Gateway -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the gateway.
[$sel:name:Gateway'] :: Gateway -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the gateway.
[$sel:description:Gateway'] :: Gateway -> Maybe Text

-- | The software version of the gateway. The gateway automatically updates
--   its software version during normal operation.
[$sel:softwareVersion:Gateway'] :: Gateway -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Gateway</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Gateway'</a>, <a>gateway_arn</a> - The ARN of the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayGroupArn:Gateway'</a>, <a>gateway_gatewayGroupArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the gateway group that the gateway is associated to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Gateway'</a>, <a>gateway_name</a> - The name of the
--   gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Gateway'</a>, <a>gateway_description</a> - The
--   description of the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:softwareVersion:Gateway'</a>, <a>gateway_softwareVersion</a> -
--   The software version of the gateway. The gateway automatically updates
--   its software version during normal operation.
newGateway :: Gateway

-- | The ARN of the gateway.
gateway_arn :: Lens' Gateway (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the gateway group that the gateway is associated to.
gateway_gatewayGroupArn :: Lens' Gateway (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the gateway.
gateway_name :: Lens' Gateway (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the gateway.
gateway_description :: Lens' Gateway (Maybe Text)

-- | The software version of the gateway. The gateway automatically updates
--   its software version during normal operation.
gateway_softwareVersion :: Lens' Gateway (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Gateway.Gateway
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Gateway.Gateway
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Gateway.Gateway
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Gateway.Gateway
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Gateway.Gateway
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Gateway.Gateway
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Gateway.Gateway

gatewayGroup_description :: Lens' GatewayGroup (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewayGroup.GatewayGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewayGroup.GatewayGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewayGroup.GatewayGroup

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewaySummary

-- | The summary of a gateway.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGatewaySummary</a> smart constructor.
data GatewaySummary
GatewaySummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GatewaySummary

-- | The ARN of the gateway.
[$sel:arn:GatewaySummary'] :: GatewaySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the gateway group that the gateway is associated to.
[$sel:gatewayGroupArn:GatewaySummary'] :: GatewaySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the gateway.
[$sel:name:GatewaySummary'] :: GatewaySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the gateway.
[$sel:description:GatewaySummary'] :: GatewaySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The software version of the gateway. The gateway automatically updates
--   its software version during normal operation.
[$sel:softwareVersion:GatewaySummary'] :: GatewaySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GatewaySummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:GatewaySummary'</a>, <a>gatewaySummary_arn</a> - The ARN
--   of the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayGroupArn:GatewaySummary'</a>,
--   <a>gatewaySummary_gatewayGroupArn</a> - The ARN of the gateway group
--   that the gateway is associated to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:GatewaySummary'</a>, <a>gatewaySummary_name</a> - The
--   name of the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:GatewaySummary'</a>,
--   <a>gatewaySummary_description</a> - The description of the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:softwareVersion:GatewaySummary'</a>,
--   <a>gatewaySummary_softwareVersion</a> - The software version of the
--   gateway. The gateway automatically updates its software version during
--   normal operation.
newGatewaySummary :: GatewaySummary

-- | The ARN of the gateway.
gatewaySummary_arn :: Lens' GatewaySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the gateway group that the gateway is associated to.
gatewaySummary_gatewayGroupArn :: Lens' GatewaySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the gateway.
gatewaySummary_name :: Lens' GatewaySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the gateway.
gatewaySummary_description :: Lens' GatewaySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The software version of the gateway. The gateway automatically updates
--   its software version during normal operation.
gatewaySummary_softwareVersion :: Lens' GatewaySummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewaySummary.GatewaySummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewaySummary.GatewaySummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewaySummary.GatewaySummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewaySummary.GatewaySummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewaySummary.GatewaySummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewaySummary.GatewaySummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.GatewaySummary.GatewaySummary


module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.IPDialIn

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIPDialIn</a> smart constructor.
data IPDialIn
IPDialIn' :: Text -> CommsProtocol -> IPDialIn

-- | The IP address.
[$sel:endpoint:IPDialIn'] :: IPDialIn -> Text

-- | The protocol, including SIP, SIPS, and H323.
[$sel:commsProtocol:IPDialIn'] :: IPDialIn -> CommsProtocol

-- | Create a value of <a>IPDialIn</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:IPDialIn'</a>, <a>iPDialIn_endpoint</a> - The IP
--   address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:commsProtocol:IPDialIn'</a>, <a>iPDialIn_commsProtocol</a> -
--   The protocol, including SIP, SIPS, and H323.
newIPDialIn :: Text -> CommsProtocol -> IPDialIn

-- | The IP address.
iPDialIn_endpoint :: Lens' IPDialIn Text

-- | The protocol, including SIP, SIPS, and H323.
iPDialIn_commsProtocol :: Lens' IPDialIn CommsProtocol

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.InstantBooking

-- | Settings for the instant booking feature that are applied to a room
--   profile. When users start their meeting with Alexa, Alexa
--   automatically books the room for the configured duration if the room
--   is available.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstantBooking</a> smart constructor.
data InstantBooking
InstantBooking' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> InstantBooking

-- | Duration between 15 and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that
--   determines how long to book an available room when a meeting is
--   started with Alexa.
[$sel:durationInMinutes:InstantBooking'] :: InstantBooking -> Maybe Int

-- | Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
[$sel:enabled:InstantBooking'] :: InstantBooking -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>InstantBooking</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInMinutes:InstantBooking'</a>,
--   <a>instantBooking_durationInMinutes</a> - Duration between 15 and 240
--   minutes at increments of 15 that determines how long to book an
--   available room when a meeting is started with Alexa.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:InstantBooking'</a>, <a>instantBooking_enabled</a> -
--   Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
newInstantBooking :: InstantBooking

-- | Duration between 15 and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that
--   determines how long to book an available room when a meeting is
--   started with Alexa.
instantBooking_durationInMinutes :: Lens' InstantBooking (Maybe Int)

-- | Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
instantBooking_enabled :: Lens' InstantBooking (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.InstantBooking.InstantBooking
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.InstantBooking.InstantBooking
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.InstantBooking.InstantBooking
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.InstantBooking.InstantBooking
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.InstantBooking.InstantBooking
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.InstantBooking.InstantBooking
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.InstantBooking.InstantBooking

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Audio

-- | The audio message. There is a 1 MB limit on the audio file input and
--   the only supported format is MP3. To convert your MP3 audio files to
--   an Alexa-friendly,
--   
--   required codec version (MPEG version 2) and bit rate (48 kbps), you
--   might use converter software. One option for this is a command-line
--   tool, FFmpeg. For more information, see <a>FFmpeg</a>. The following
--   command converts the provided &lt;input-file&gt; to an MP3 file that
--   is played in the announcement:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ffmpeg -i &lt;input-file&gt; -ac 2 -codec:a libmp3lame -b:a 48k -ar 16000 &lt;output-file.mp3&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudio</a> smart constructor.
data Audio
Audio' :: Locale -> Text -> Audio

-- | The locale of the audio message. Currently, en-US is supported.
[$sel:locale:Audio'] :: Audio -> Locale

-- | The location of the audio file. Currently, S3 URLs are supported. Only
--   S3 locations comprised of safe characters are valid. For more
--   information, see <a>Safe Characters</a>.
[$sel:location:Audio'] :: Audio -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Audio</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:Audio'</a>, <a>audio_locale</a> - The locale of the
--   audio message. Currently, en-US is supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Audio'</a>, <a>audio_location</a> - The location of
--   the audio file. Currently, S3 URLs are supported. Only S3 locations
--   comprised of safe characters are valid. For more information, see
--   <a>Safe Characters</a>.
newAudio :: Locale -> Text -> Audio

-- | The locale of the audio message. Currently, en-US is supported.
audio_locale :: Lens' Audio Locale

-- | The location of the audio file. Currently, S3 URLs are supported. Only
--   S3 locations comprised of safe characters are valid. For more
--   information, see <a>Safe Characters</a>.
audio_location :: Lens' Audio Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Audio.Audio
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Audio.Audio
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Audio.Audio
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Audio.Audio
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Audio.Audio
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Audio.Audio
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Audio.Audio

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfileData

-- | The data associated with a network profile.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkProfileData</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkProfileData
NetworkProfileData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkEapMethod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkSecurityType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkProfileData

-- | The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS
--   Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the
--   devices.
[$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:NetworkProfileData'] :: NetworkProfileData -> Maybe Text

-- | The authentication standard that is used in the EAP framework.
--   Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
[$sel:eapMethod:NetworkProfileData'] :: NetworkProfileData -> Maybe NetworkEapMethod

-- | The name of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileName:NetworkProfileData'] :: NetworkProfileData -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.
[$sel:description:NetworkProfileData'] :: NetworkProfileData -> Maybe Text

-- | The security type of the Wi-Fi network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE,
--   WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or OPEN.
[$sel:securityType:NetworkProfileData'] :: NetworkProfileData -> Maybe NetworkSecurityType

-- | The ARN of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileArn:NetworkProfileData'] :: NetworkProfileData -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
[$sel:ssid:NetworkProfileData'] :: NetworkProfileData -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkProfileData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_certificateAuthorityArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS Certificate Manager
--   (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eapMethod:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_eapMethod</a> - The authentication standard that
--   is used in the EAP framework. Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileName:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_networkProfileName</a> - The name of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_description</a> - Detailed information about a
--   device's network profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityType:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_securityType</a> - The security type of the
--   Wi-Fi network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE, WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or
--   OPEN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileArn:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_networkProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ssid:NetworkProfileData'</a>, <a>networkProfileData_ssid</a> -
--   The SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
newNetworkProfileData :: NetworkProfileData

-- | The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS
--   Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the
--   devices.
networkProfileData_certificateAuthorityArn :: Lens' NetworkProfileData (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication standard that is used in the EAP framework.
--   Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
networkProfileData_eapMethod :: Lens' NetworkProfileData (Maybe NetworkEapMethod)

-- | The name of the network profile associated with a device.
networkProfileData_networkProfileName :: Lens' NetworkProfileData (Maybe Text)

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.
networkProfileData_description :: Lens' NetworkProfileData (Maybe Text)

-- | The security type of the Wi-Fi network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE,
--   WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or OPEN.
networkProfileData_securityType :: Lens' NetworkProfileData (Maybe NetworkSecurityType)

-- | The ARN of the network profile associated with a device.
networkProfileData_networkProfileArn :: Lens' NetworkProfileData (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
networkProfileData_ssid :: Lens' NetworkProfileData (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfileData.NetworkProfileData
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfileData.NetworkProfileData
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfileData.NetworkProfileData
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfileData.NetworkProfileData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfileData.NetworkProfileData
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfileData.NetworkProfileData
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfileData.NetworkProfileData


module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfile

-- | The network profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkProfile</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkProfile
NetworkProfile' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe NetworkEapMethod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkSecurityType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkProfile

-- | The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS
--   Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the
--   devices.
[$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The root certificates of your authentication server, which is
--   installed on your devices and used to trust your authentication server
--   during EAP negotiation.
[$sel:trustAnchors:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The current password of the Wi-Fi network.
[$sel:currentPassword:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The authentication standard that is used in the EAP framework.
--   Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
[$sel:eapMethod:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe NetworkEapMethod

-- | The name of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileName:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.
[$sel:description:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The security type of the Wi-Fi network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE,
--   WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or OPEN.
[$sel:securityType:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe NetworkSecurityType

-- | The next, or subsequent, password of the Wi-Fi network. This password
--   is asynchronously transmitted to the device and is used when the
--   password of the network changes to NextPassword.
[$sel:nextPassword:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The ARN of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileArn:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
[$sel:ssid:NetworkProfile'] :: NetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_certificateAuthorityArn</a> - The ARN of the Private
--   Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).
--   This is used to issue certificates to the devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trustAnchors:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_trustAnchors</a> - The root certificates of your
--   authentication server, which is installed on your devices and used to
--   trust your authentication server during EAP negotiation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentPassword:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_currentPassword</a> - The current password of the
--   Wi-Fi network.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eapMethod:NetworkProfile'</a>, <a>networkProfile_eapMethod</a>
--   - The authentication standard that is used in the EAP framework.
--   Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileName:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_networkProfileName</a> - The name of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_description</a> - Detailed information about a
--   device's network profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityType:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_securityType</a> - The security type of the Wi-Fi
--   network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE, WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or OPEN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPassword:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_nextPassword</a> - The next, or subsequent, password
--   of the Wi-Fi network. This password is asynchronously transmitted to
--   the device and is used when the password of the network changes to
--   NextPassword.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileArn:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_networkProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ssid:NetworkProfile'</a>, <a>networkProfile_ssid</a> - The
--   SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
newNetworkProfile :: NetworkProfile

-- | The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS
--   Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the
--   devices.
networkProfile_certificateAuthorityArn :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The root certificates of your authentication server, which is
--   installed on your devices and used to trust your authentication server
--   during EAP negotiation.
networkProfile_trustAnchors :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The current password of the Wi-Fi network.
networkProfile_currentPassword :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication standard that is used in the EAP framework.
--   Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
networkProfile_eapMethod :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe NetworkEapMethod)

-- | The name of the network profile associated with a device.
networkProfile_networkProfileName :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.
networkProfile_description :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The security type of the Wi-Fi network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE,
--   WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or OPEN.
networkProfile_securityType :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe NetworkSecurityType)

-- | The next, or subsequent, password of the Wi-Fi network. This password
--   is asynchronously transmitted to the device and is used when the
--   password of the network changes to NextPassword.
networkProfile_nextPassword :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the network profile associated with a device.
networkProfile_networkProfileArn :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
networkProfile_ssid :: Lens' NetworkProfile (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfile.NetworkProfile
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfile.NetworkProfile
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfile.NetworkProfile
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfile.NetworkProfile
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfile.NetworkProfile
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.NetworkProfile.NetworkProfile


module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.PSTNDialIn

-- | The information for public switched telephone network (PSTN)
--   conferencing.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPSTNDialIn</a> smart constructor.
data PSTNDialIn
PSTNDialIn' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PSTNDialIn

-- | The zip code.
[$sel:countryCode:PSTNDialIn'] :: PSTNDialIn -> Text

-- | The phone number to call to join the conference.
[$sel:phoneNumber:PSTNDialIn'] :: PSTNDialIn -> Text

-- | The delay duration before Alexa enters the conference ID with
--   dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each number on the dial pad
--   corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we send data over the
--   telephone network.
[$sel:oneClickIdDelay:PSTNDialIn'] :: PSTNDialIn -> Text

-- | The delay duration before Alexa enters the conference pin with
--   dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each number on the dial pad
--   corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we send data over the
--   telephone network.
[$sel:oneClickPinDelay:PSTNDialIn'] :: PSTNDialIn -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PSTNDialIn</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:countryCode:PSTNDialIn'</a>, <a>pSTNDialIn_countryCode</a> -
--   The zip code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:PSTNDialIn'</a>, <a>pSTNDialIn_phoneNumber</a> -
--   The phone number to call to join the conference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oneClickIdDelay:PSTNDialIn'</a>,
--   <a>pSTNDialIn_oneClickIdDelay</a> - The delay duration before Alexa
--   enters the conference ID with dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each
--   number on the dial pad corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we
--   send data over the telephone network.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oneClickPinDelay:PSTNDialIn'</a>,
--   <a>pSTNDialIn_oneClickPinDelay</a> - The delay duration before Alexa
--   enters the conference pin with dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each
--   number on the dial pad corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we
--   send data over the telephone network.
newPSTNDialIn :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PSTNDialIn

-- | The zip code.
pSTNDialIn_countryCode :: Lens' PSTNDialIn Text

-- | The phone number to call to join the conference.
pSTNDialIn_phoneNumber :: Lens' PSTNDialIn Text

-- | The delay duration before Alexa enters the conference ID with
--   dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each number on the dial pad
--   corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we send data over the
--   telephone network.
pSTNDialIn_oneClickIdDelay :: Lens' PSTNDialIn Text

-- | The delay duration before Alexa enters the conference pin with
--   dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each number on the dial pad
--   corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we send data over the
--   telephone network.
pSTNDialIn_oneClickPinDelay :: Lens' PSTNDialIn Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.PSTNDialIn.PSTNDialIn
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.PSTNDialIn.PSTNDialIn
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.PSTNDialIn.PSTNDialIn
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.PSTNDialIn.PSTNDialIn

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.RequireCheckIn

-- | Settings for the require check in feature that are applied to a room
--   profile. Require check in allows a meeting roomâ€™s Alexa or AVS device
--   to prompt the user to check in; otherwise, the room will be released.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRequireCheckIn</a> smart constructor.
data RequireCheckIn
RequireCheckIn' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> RequireCheckIn

-- | Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the
--   room if it's not checked into.
[$sel:releaseAfterMinutes:RequireCheckIn'] :: RequireCheckIn -> Maybe Int

-- | Whether require check in is enabled or not.
[$sel:enabled:RequireCheckIn'] :: RequireCheckIn -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>RequireCheckIn</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseAfterMinutes:RequireCheckIn'</a>,
--   <a>requireCheckIn_releaseAfterMinutes</a> - Duration between 5 and 20
--   minutes to determine when to release the room if it's not checked
--   into.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:RequireCheckIn'</a>, <a>requireCheckIn_enabled</a> -
--   Whether require check in is enabled or not.
newRequireCheckIn :: RequireCheckIn

-- | Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the
--   room if it's not checked into.
requireCheckIn_releaseAfterMinutes :: Lens' RequireCheckIn (Maybe Int)

-- | Whether require check in is enabled or not.
requireCheckIn_enabled :: Lens' RequireCheckIn (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.RequireCheckIn.RequireCheckIn
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.RequireCheckIn.RequireCheckIn

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.RequireCheckIn.RequireCheckIn


module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | Meeting room settings of a room profile.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMeetingRoomConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data MeetingRoomConfiguration
MeetingRoomConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe EndOfMeetingReminder -> Maybe InstantBooking -> Maybe RequireCheckIn -> MeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
[$sel:roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled:MeetingRoomConfiguration'] :: MeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Settings for the end of meeting reminder feature that are applied to a
--   room profile. The end of meeting reminder enables Alexa to remind
--   users when a meeting is ending.
[$sel:endOfMeetingReminder:MeetingRoomConfiguration'] :: MeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe EndOfMeetingReminder

-- | Settings to automatically book the room if available for a configured
--   duration when joining a meeting with Alexa.
[$sel:instantBooking:MeetingRoomConfiguration'] :: MeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe InstantBooking

-- | Settings for requiring a check in when a room is reserved. Alexa can
--   cancel a room reservation if it's not checked into. This makes the
--   room available for others. Users can check in by joining the meeting
--   with Alexa or an AVS device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
[$sel:requireCheckIn:MeetingRoomConfiguration'] :: MeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe RequireCheckIn

-- | Create a value of <a>MeetingRoomConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled:MeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>meetingRoomConfiguration_roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled</a> -
--   Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOfMeetingReminder:MeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>meetingRoomConfiguration_endOfMeetingReminder</a> - Settings for
--   the end of meeting reminder feature that are applied to a room
--   profile. The end of meeting reminder enables Alexa to remind users
--   when a meeting is ending.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instantBooking:MeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>meetingRoomConfiguration_instantBooking</a> - Settings to
--   automatically book the room if available for a configured duration
--   when joining a meeting with Alexa.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireCheckIn:MeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>meetingRoomConfiguration_requireCheckIn</a> - Settings for
--   requiring a check in when a room is reserved. Alexa can cancel a room
--   reservation if it's not checked into. This makes the room available
--   for others. Users can check in by joining the meeting with Alexa or an
--   AVS device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
newMeetingRoomConfiguration :: MeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
meetingRoomConfiguration_roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled :: Lens' MeetingRoomConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Settings for the end of meeting reminder feature that are applied to a
--   room profile. The end of meeting reminder enables Alexa to remind
--   users when a meeting is ending.
meetingRoomConfiguration_endOfMeetingReminder :: Lens' MeetingRoomConfiguration (Maybe EndOfMeetingReminder)

-- | Settings to automatically book the room if available for a configured
--   duration when joining a meeting with Alexa.
meetingRoomConfiguration_instantBooking :: Lens' MeetingRoomConfiguration (Maybe InstantBooking)

-- | Settings for requiring a check in when a room is reserved. Alexa can
--   cancel a room reservation if it's not checked into. This makes the
--   room available for others. Users can check in by joining the meeting
--   with Alexa or an AVS device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
meetingRoomConfiguration_requireCheckIn :: Lens' MeetingRoomConfiguration (Maybe RequireCheckIn)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingRoomConfiguration.MeetingRoomConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingRoomConfiguration.MeetingRoomConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingRoomConfiguration.MeetingRoomConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingRoomConfiguration.MeetingRoomConfiguration

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting

-- | The values that indicate whether a pin is always required (YES), never
--   required (NO), or OPTIONAL.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If YES, Alexa will always ask for a meeting pin.</li>
--   <li>If NO, Alexa will never ask for a meeting pin.</li>
--   <li>If OPTIONAL, Alexa will ask if you have a meeting pin and if the
--   customer responds with yes, it will ask for the meeting pin.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMeetingSetting</a> smart constructor.
data MeetingSetting
MeetingSetting' :: RequirePin -> MeetingSetting

-- | The values that indicate whether the pin is always required.
[$sel:requirePin:MeetingSetting'] :: MeetingSetting -> RequirePin

-- | Create a value of <a>MeetingSetting</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requirePin:MeetingSetting'</a>,
--   <a>meetingSetting_requirePin</a> - The values that indicate whether
--   the pin is always required.
newMeetingSetting :: RequirePin -> MeetingSetting

-- | The values that indicate whether the pin is always required.
meetingSetting_requirePin :: Lens' MeetingSetting RequirePin
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting.MeetingSetting
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting.MeetingSetting
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting.MeetingSetting
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting.MeetingSetting
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting.MeetingSetting
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting.MeetingSetting
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting.MeetingSetting
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.MeetingSetting.MeetingSetting


module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ConferenceProvider

-- | An entity that provides a conferencing solution. Alexa for Business
--   acts as the voice interface and mediator that connects users to their
--   preferred conference provider. Examples of conference providers
--   include Amazon Chime, Zoom, Cisco, and Polycom.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConferenceProvider</a> smart constructor.
data ConferenceProvider
ConferenceProvider' :: Maybe MeetingSetting -> Maybe IPDialIn -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PSTNDialIn -> Maybe ConferenceProviderType -> ConferenceProvider

-- | The meeting settings for the conference provider.
[$sel:meetingSetting:ConferenceProvider'] :: ConferenceProvider -> Maybe MeetingSetting

-- | The IP endpoint and protocol for calling.
[$sel:iPDialIn:ConferenceProvider'] :: ConferenceProvider -> Maybe IPDialIn

-- | The ARN of the newly created conference provider.
[$sel:arn:ConferenceProvider'] :: ConferenceProvider -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the conference provider.
[$sel:name:ConferenceProvider'] :: ConferenceProvider -> Maybe Text

-- | The information for PSTN conferencing.
[$sel:pSTNDialIn:ConferenceProvider'] :: ConferenceProvider -> Maybe PSTNDialIn

-- | The type of conference providers.
[$sel:type':ConferenceProvider'] :: ConferenceProvider -> Maybe ConferenceProviderType

-- | Create a value of <a>ConferenceProvider</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:meetingSetting:ConferenceProvider'</a>,
--   <a>conferenceProvider_meetingSetting</a> - The meeting settings for
--   the conference provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iPDialIn:ConferenceProvider'</a>,
--   <a>conferenceProvider_iPDialIn</a> - The IP endpoint and protocol for
--   calling.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ConferenceProvider'</a>, <a>conferenceProvider_arn</a> -
--   The ARN of the newly created conference provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ConferenceProvider'</a>, <a>conferenceProvider_name</a> -
--   The name of the conference provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pSTNDialIn:ConferenceProvider'</a>,
--   <a>conferenceProvider_pSTNDialIn</a> - The information for PSTN
--   conferencing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ConferenceProvider'</a>, <a>conferenceProvider_type</a>
--   - The type of conference providers.
newConferenceProvider :: ConferenceProvider

-- | The meeting settings for the conference provider.
conferenceProvider_meetingSetting :: Lens' ConferenceProvider (Maybe MeetingSetting)

-- | The IP endpoint and protocol for calling.
conferenceProvider_iPDialIn :: Lens' ConferenceProvider (Maybe IPDialIn)

-- | The ARN of the newly created conference provider.
conferenceProvider_arn :: Lens' ConferenceProvider (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the conference provider.
conferenceProvider_name :: Lens' ConferenceProvider (Maybe Text)

-- | The information for PSTN conferencing.
conferenceProvider_pSTNDialIn :: Lens' ConferenceProvider (Maybe PSTNDialIn)

-- | The type of conference providers.
conferenceProvider_type :: Lens' ConferenceProvider (Maybe ConferenceProviderType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ConferenceProvider.ConferenceProvider
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ConferenceProvider.ConferenceProvider
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ConferenceProvider.ConferenceProvider
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ConferenceProvider.ConferenceProvider
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ConferenceProvider.ConferenceProvider
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ConferenceProvider.ConferenceProvider
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ConferenceProvider.ConferenceProvider

--   the SIP address.

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ContactData

-- | Information related to a contact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactData</a> smart constructor.
data ContactData
ContactData' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [PhoneNumber] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [SipAddress] -> ContactData

-- | The phone number of the contact. The phone number type defaults to
--   WORK. You can specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We recommend that
--   you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone number type and
--   multiple numbers.
[$sel:phoneNumber:ContactData'] :: ContactData -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The list of phone numbers for the contact.
[$sel:phoneNumbers:ContactData'] :: ContactData -> Maybe [PhoneNumber]

-- | The last name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
[$sel:lastName:ContactData'] :: ContactData -> Maybe Text

-- | The first name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
[$sel:firstName:ContactData'] :: ContactData -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the contact.
[$sel:contactArn:ContactData'] :: ContactData -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the contact to display on the console.
[$sel:displayName:ContactData'] :: ContactData -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of SIP addresses for the contact.
[$sel:sipAddresses:ContactData'] :: ContactData -> Maybe [SipAddress]

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactData</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:ContactData'</a>, <a>contactData_phoneNumber</a> -
--   The phone number of the contact. The phone number type defaults to
--   WORK. You can specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We recommend that
--   you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone number type and
--   multiple numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumbers:ContactData'</a>, <a>contactData_phoneNumbers</a>
--   - The list of phone numbers for the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastName:ContactData'</a>, <a>contactData_lastName</a> - The
--   last name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstName:ContactData'</a>, <a>contactData_firstName</a> - The
--   first name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:ContactData'</a>, <a>contactData_contactArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:ContactData'</a>, <a>contactData_displayName</a> -
--   The name of the contact to display on the console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sipAddresses:ContactData'</a>, <a>contactData_sipAddresses</a>
--   - The list of SIP addresses for the contact.
newContactData :: ContactData

-- | The phone number of the contact. The phone number type defaults to
--   WORK. You can specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We recommend that
--   you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone number type and
--   multiple numbers.
contactData_phoneNumber :: Lens' ContactData (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of phone numbers for the contact.
contactData_phoneNumbers :: Lens' ContactData (Maybe [PhoneNumber])

-- | The last name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
contactData_lastName :: Lens' ContactData (Maybe Text)

-- | The first name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
contactData_firstName :: Lens' ContactData (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the contact.
contactData_contactArn :: Lens' ContactData (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the contact to display on the console.
contactData_displayName :: Lens' ContactData (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of SIP addresses for the contact.
contactData_sipAddresses :: Lens' ContactData (Maybe [SipAddress])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ContactData.ContactData
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ContactData.ContactData
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ContactData.ContactData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ContactData.ContactData
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ContactData.ContactData
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.ContactData.ContactData


module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Contact

-- | A contact with attributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContact</a> smart constructor.
data Contact
Contact' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [PhoneNumber] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [SipAddress] -> Contact

-- | The phone number of the contact. The phone number type defaults to
--   WORK. You can either specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We recommend
--   that you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone number
--   type and multiple numbers.
[$sel:phoneNumber:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The list of phone numbers for the contact.
[$sel:phoneNumbers:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe [PhoneNumber]

-- | The last name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
[$sel:lastName:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Text

-- | The first name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
[$sel:firstName:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the contact.
[$sel:contactArn:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the contact to display on the console.
[$sel:displayName:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of SIP addresses for the contact.
[$sel:sipAddresses:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe [SipAddress]

-- | Create a value of <a>Contact</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_phoneNumber</a> - The
--   phone number of the contact. The phone number type defaults to WORK.
--   You can either specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We recommend that
--   you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone number type and
--   multiple numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumbers:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_phoneNumbers</a> - The
--   list of phone numbers for the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_lastName</a> - The last name
--   of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_firstName</a> - The first
--   name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_contactArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_displayName</a> - The
--   name of the contact to display on the console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sipAddresses:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_sipAddresses</a> - The
--   list of SIP addresses for the contact.
newContact :: Contact

-- | The phone number of the contact. The phone number type defaults to
--   WORK. You can either specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We recommend
--   that you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone number
--   type and multiple numbers.
contact_phoneNumber :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of phone numbers for the contact.
contact_phoneNumbers :: Lens' Contact (Maybe [PhoneNumber])

-- | The last name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
contact_lastName :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | The first name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
contact_firstName :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the contact.
contact_contactArn :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the contact to display on the console.
contact_displayName :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of SIP addresses for the contact.
contact_sipAddresses :: Lens' Contact (Maybe [SipAddress])

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.Contact.Contact

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.SkillDetails

-- | Granular information about the skill.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSkillDetails</a> smart constructor.
data SkillDetails
SkillDetails' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe DeveloperInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SkillDetails

-- | The updates added in bullet points.
[$sel:newInThisVersionBulletPoints':SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The types of skills.
[$sel:skillTypes:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The details about what the skill supports organized as bullet points.
[$sel:bulletPoints:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | <i>This member has been deprecated.</i>
--   
--   The list of reviews for the skill, including Key and Value pair.
[$sel:reviews:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The URL of the end user license agreement.
[$sel:endUserLicenseAgreement:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The generic keywords associated with the skill that can be used to
--   find a skill.
[$sel:genericKeywords:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The details about the developer that published the skill.
[$sel:developerInfo:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe DeveloperInfo

-- | The description of the product.
[$sel:productDescription:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The phrase used to trigger the skill.
[$sel:invocationPhrase:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the skill was released.
[$sel:releaseDate:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SkillDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:newInThisVersionBulletPoints':SkillDetails'</a>,
--   <a>skillDetails_newInThisVersionBulletPoints</a> - The updates added
--   in bullet points.
--   
--   <a>$sel:skillTypes:SkillDetails'</a>, <a>skillDetails_skillTypes</a> -
--   The types of skills.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulletPoints:SkillDetails'</a>,
--   <a>skillDetails_bulletPoints</a> - The details about what the skill
--   supports organized as bullet points.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reviews:SkillDetails'</a>, <a>skillDetails_reviews</a> -
--   <i>This member has been deprecated.</i>
--   
--   The list of reviews for the skill, including Key and Value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endUserLicenseAgreement:SkillDetails'</a>,
--   <a>skillDetails_endUserLicenseAgreement</a> - The URL of the end user
--   license agreement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:genericKeywords:SkillDetails'</a>,
--   <a>skillDetails_genericKeywords</a> - The generic keywords associated
--   with the skill that can be used to find a skill.
--   
--   <a>$sel:developerInfo:SkillDetails'</a>,
--   <a>skillDetails_developerInfo</a> - The details about the developer
--   that published the skill.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productDescription:SkillDetails'</a>,
--   <a>skillDetails_productDescription</a> - The description of the
--   product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:invocationPhrase:SkillDetails'</a>,
--   <a>skillDetails_invocationPhrase</a> - The phrase used to trigger the
--   skill.
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseDate:SkillDetails'</a>, <a>skillDetails_releaseDate</a>
--   - The date when the skill was released.
newSkillDetails :: SkillDetails

-- | The updates added in bullet points.
skillDetails_newInThisVersionBulletPoints :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe [Text])

-- | The types of skills.
skillDetails_skillTypes :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe [Text])

-- | The details about what the skill supports organized as bullet points.
skillDetails_bulletPoints :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe [Text])

-- | <i>This member has been deprecated.</i>
--   
--   The list of reviews for the skill, including Key and Value pair.
skillDetails_reviews :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The URL of the end user license agreement.
skillDetails_endUserLicenseAgreement :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The generic keywords associated with the skill that can be used to
--   find a skill.
skillDetails_genericKeywords :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe [Text])

-- | The details about the developer that published the skill.
skillDetails_developerInfo :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe DeveloperInfo)

-- | The description of the product.
skillDetails_productDescription :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The phrase used to trigger the skill.
skillDetails_invocationPhrase :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the skill was released.
skillDetails_releaseDate :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.SkillDetails.SkillDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.SkillDetails.SkillDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.SkillDetails.SkillDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.SkillDetails.SkillDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.SkillDetails.SkillDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.SkillDetails.SkillDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Types.SkillDetails.SkillDetails
