-- | The information for public switched telephone network (PSTN)
--   conferencing.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPSTNDialIn</a> smart constructor.
data PSTNDialIn
PSTNDialIn' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PSTNDialIn

-- | The zip code.
[$sel:countryCode:PSTNDialIn'] :: PSTNDialIn -> Text

-- | The phone number to call to join the conference.
[$sel:phoneNumber:PSTNDialIn'] :: PSTNDialIn -> Text

-- | The delay duration before Alexa enters the conference ID with
--   dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each number on the dial pad
--   corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we send data over the
--   telephone network.
[$sel:oneClickIdDelay:PSTNDialIn'] :: PSTNDialIn -> Text

-- | The delay duration before Alexa enters the conference pin with
--   dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each number on the dial pad
--   corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we send data over the
--   telephone network.
[$sel:oneClickPinDelay:PSTNDialIn'] :: PSTNDialIn -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PSTNDialIn</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:countryCode:PSTNDialIn'</a>, <a>pSTNDialIn_countryCode</a> -
--   The zip code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:PSTNDialIn'</a>, <a>pSTNDialIn_phoneNumber</a> -
--   The phone number to call to join the conference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oneClickIdDelay:PSTNDialIn'</a>,
--   <a>pSTNDialIn_oneClickIdDelay</a> - The delay duration before Alexa
--   enters the conference ID with dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each
--   number on the dial pad corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we
--   send data over the telephone network.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oneClickPinDelay:PSTNDialIn'</a>,
--   <a>pSTNDialIn_oneClickPinDelay</a> - The delay duration before Alexa
--   enters the conference pin with dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each
--   number on the dial pad corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we
--   send data over the telephone network.
newPSTNDialIn :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PSTNDialIn

-- | The zip code.
pSTNDialIn_countryCode :: Lens' PSTNDialIn Text

-- | The phone number to call to join the conference.
pSTNDialIn_phoneNumber :: Lens' PSTNDialIn Text

-- | The delay duration before Alexa enters the conference ID with
--   dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each number on the dial pad
--   corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we send data over the
--   telephone network.
pSTNDialIn_oneClickIdDelay :: Lens' PSTNDialIn Text

-- | The delay duration before Alexa enters the conference pin with
--   dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each number on the dial pad
--   corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we send data over the
--   telephone network.
pSTNDialIn_oneClickPinDelay :: Lens' PSTNDialIn Text

-- | The phone number for the contact containing the raw number and phone
--   number type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPhoneNumber</a> smart constructor.
data PhoneNumber
PhoneNumber' :: Sensitive Text -> Sensitive PhoneNumberType -> PhoneNumber

-- | The raw value of the phone number.
[$sel:number:PhoneNumber'] :: PhoneNumber -> Sensitive Text

-- | The type of the phone number.
[$sel:type':PhoneNumber'] :: PhoneNumber -> Sensitive PhoneNumberType

-- | Create a value of <a>PhoneNumber</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:number:PhoneNumber'</a>, <a>phoneNumber_number</a> - The raw
--   value of the phone number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PhoneNumber'</a>, <a>phoneNumber_type</a> - The type of
--   the phone number.
newPhoneNumber :: Text -> PhoneNumberType -> PhoneNumber

-- | The raw value of the phone number.
phoneNumber_number :: Lens' PhoneNumber Text

-- | The type of the phone number.
phoneNumber_type :: Lens' PhoneNumber PhoneNumberType

-- | A room profile with attributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProfile</a> smart constructor.
data Profile
Profile' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TemperatureUnit -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe WakeWord -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DistanceUnit -> Profile

-- | The name of a room profile.
[$sel:profileName:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Text

-- | Retrieves if the profile is default or not.
[$sel:isDefault:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The address of a room profile.
[$sel:address:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Text

-- | The locale of a room profile. (This is currently available only to a
--   limited preview audience.)
[$sel:locale:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Text

-- | The temperature unit of a room profile.
[$sel:temperatureUnit:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe TemperatureUnit

-- | The ARN of the address book.
[$sel:addressBookArn:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Text

-- | The PSTN setting of a room profile.
[$sel:pSTNEnabled:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The setup mode of a room profile.
[$sel:setupModeDisabled:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The max volume limit of a room profile.
[$sel:maxVolumeLimit:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Int

-- | The wake word of a room profile.
[$sel:wakeWord:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe WakeWord

-- | The ARN of a room profile.
[$sel:profileArn:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Text

-- | Meeting room settings of a room profile.
[$sel:meetingRoomConfiguration:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe MeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | The time zone of a room profile.
[$sel:timezone:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether data retention of the profile is enabled.
[$sel:dataRetentionOptIn:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The distance unit of a room profile.
[$sel:distanceUnit:Profile'] :: Profile -> Maybe DistanceUnit

-- | Create a value of <a>Profile</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:profileName:Profile'</a>, <a>profile_profileName</a> - The
--   name of a room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefault:Profile'</a>, <a>profile_isDefault</a> - Retrieves
--   if the profile is default or not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:Profile'</a>, <a>profile_address</a> - The address of
--   a room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:Profile'</a>, <a>profile_locale</a> - The locale of a
--   room profile. (This is currently available only to a limited preview
--   audience.)
--

--   The temperature unit of a room profile.
--

--   The ARN of the address book.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pSTNEnabled:Profile'</a>, <a>profile_pSTNEnabled</a> - The
--   PSTN setting of a room profile.

--   <a>$sel:maxVolumeLimit:Profile'</a>, <a>profile_maxVolumeLimit</a> -
--   The max volume limit of a room profile.
--

--   of a room profile.

--   <a>$sel:profileArn:Profile'</a>, <a>profile_profileArn</a> - The ARN

newProfile :: Profile

-- | Settings for the require check in feature that are applied to a room
--   profile. Require check in allows a meeting roomâ€™s Alexa or AVS device
--   to prompt the user to check in; otherwise, the room will be released.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRequireCheckIn</a> smart constructor.
data RequireCheckIn
RequireCheckIn' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> RequireCheckIn

-- | Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the
--   room if it's not checked into.
[$sel:releaseAfterMinutes:RequireCheckIn'] :: RequireCheckIn -> Maybe Int

-- | Whether require check in is enabled or not.
[$sel:enabled:RequireCheckIn'] :: RequireCheckIn -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>RequireCheckIn</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseAfterMinutes:RequireCheckIn'</a>,
--   <a>requireCheckIn_releaseAfterMinutes</a> - Duration between 5 and 20
--   minutes to determine when to release the room if it's not checked
--   into.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:RequireCheckIn'</a>, <a>requireCheckIn_enabled</a> -
--   Whether require check in is enabled or not.
newRequireCheckIn :: RequireCheckIn

-- | Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the
--   room if it's not checked into.
requireCheckIn_releaseAfterMinutes :: Lens' RequireCheckIn (Maybe Int)

-- | Whether require check in is enabled or not.
requireCheckIn_enabled :: Lens' RequireCheckIn (Maybe Bool)

-- | Granular information about the skill.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSkillDetails</a> smart constructor.
data SkillDetails
SkillDetails' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe DeveloperInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SkillDetails

-- | The updates added in bullet points.
[$sel:newInThisVersionBulletPoints':SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The types of skills.
[$sel:skillTypes:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The details about what the skill supports organized as bullet points.
[$sel:bulletPoints:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | <i>This member has been deprecated.</i>
--   
--   The list of reviews for the skill, including Key and Value pair.
[$sel:reviews:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The URL of the end user license agreement.
[$sel:endUserLicenseAgreement:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The generic keywords associated with the skill that can be used to
--   find a skill.
[$sel:genericKeywords:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The details about the developer that published the skill.
[$sel:developerInfo:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe DeveloperInfo

-- | The description of the product.
[$sel:productDescription:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The phrase used to trigger the skill.
[$sel:invocationPhrase:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the skill was released.
[$sel:releaseDate:SkillDetails'] :: SkillDetails -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.

--   The types of skills.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulletPoints:SkillDetails'</a>,
--   <a>skillDetails_bulletPoints</a> - The details about what the skill
--   supports organized as bullet points.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reviews:SkillDetails'</a>, <a>skillDetails_reviews</a> -

skillDetails_skillTypes :: Lens' SkillDetails (Maybe [Text])

--   requires linking to be used.

--   ARN of the skill summary.

--   <a>skillSummary_supportsLinking</a> - Linking support for a skill.
--   
--   <a>$sel:skillType:SkillSummary'</a>, <a>skillSummary_skillType</a> -
--   Whether the skill is publicly available or is a private skill.

--

--   under the user's account, or if it requires linking to be used.

-- | The SSML message. For more information, see <a>SSML Reference</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSsml</a> smart constructor.
data Ssml
Ssml' :: Locale -> Text -> Ssml

-- | The locale of the SSML message. Currently, en-US is supported.
[$sel:locale:Ssml'] :: Ssml -> Locale

-- | The value of the SSML message in the correct SSML format. The audio
--   tag is not supported.
[$sel:value:Ssml'] :: Ssml -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Ssml</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:Ssml'</a>, <a>ssml_locale</a> - The locale of the SSML
--   message. Currently, en-US is supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Ssml'</a>, <a>ssml_value</a> - The value of the SSML
--   message in the correct SSML format. The audio tag is not supported.
newSsml :: Locale -> Text -> Ssml

-- | The locale of the SSML message. Currently, en-US is supported.
ssml_locale :: Lens' Ssml Locale

-- | The value of the SSML message in the correct SSML format. The audio
--   tag is not supported.
ssml_value :: Lens' Ssml Text

-- | A key-value pair that can be associated with a resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The key of a tag. Tag keys are case-sensitive.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The value of a tag. Tag values are case sensitive and can be null.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key of a tag. Tag keys are
--   case-sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value of a tag. Tag
--   values are case sensitive and can be null.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The key of a tag. Tag keys are case-sensitive.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The value of a tag. Tag values are case sensitive and can be null.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

--

-- | Updates settings for the instant booking feature that are applied to a
--   room profile. If instant booking is enabled, Alexa automatically
--   reserves a room if it is free when a user joins a meeting with Alexa.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateInstantBooking</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateInstantBooking
UpdateInstantBooking' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> UpdateInstantBooking

--   determines how long to book an available room when a meeting is
--   started with Alexa.
[$sel:durationInMinutes:UpdateInstantBooking'] :: UpdateInstantBooking -> Maybe Int

-- | Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
[$sel:enabled:UpdateInstantBooking'] :: UpdateInstantBooking -> Maybe Bool

--   omitted.

--   an available room when a meeting is started with Alexa.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:UpdateInstantBooking'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstantBooking_enabled</a> - Whether instant booking is
--   enabled or not.
newUpdateInstantBooking :: UpdateInstantBooking

--   started with Alexa.

--   configured duration when joining a meeting with Alexa.

--   cancel a room reservation if it's not checked into to make the room
--   available for others. Users can check in by joining the meeting with
--   Alexa or an AVS device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€

-- | Settings for requiring a check in when a room is reserved. Alexa can

-- | Updates settings for the require check in feature that are applied to
--   a room profile. Require check in allows a meeting roomâ€™s Alexa or AVS
--   device to prompt the user to check in; otherwise, the room will be
--   released.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRequireCheckIn</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateRequireCheckIn
UpdateRequireCheckIn' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> UpdateRequireCheckIn

-- | Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the
--   room if it's not checked into.
[$sel:releaseAfterMinutes:UpdateRequireCheckIn'] :: UpdateRequireCheckIn -> Maybe Int

-- | Whether require check in is enabled or not.
[$sel:enabled:UpdateRequireCheckIn'] :: UpdateRequireCheckIn -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRequireCheckIn</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseAfterMinutes:UpdateRequireCheckIn'</a>,
--   <a>updateRequireCheckIn_releaseAfterMinutes</a> - Duration between 5
--   and 20 minutes to determine when to release the room if it's not
--   checked into.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:UpdateRequireCheckIn'</a>,
--   <a>updateRequireCheckIn_enabled</a> - Whether require check in is
--   enabled or not.
newUpdateRequireCheckIn :: UpdateRequireCheckIn

-- | Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the
--   room if it's not checked into.
updateRequireCheckIn_releaseAfterMinutes :: Lens' UpdateRequireCheckIn (Maybe Int)

-- | Whether require check in is enabled or not.
updateRequireCheckIn_enabled :: Lens' UpdateRequireCheckIn (Maybe Bool)

-- | Information related to a user.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserData</a> smart constructor.
data UserData
UserData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EnrollmentStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UserData

-- | The ARN of a user.
[$sel:userArn:UserData'] :: UserData -> Maybe Text

-- | The enrollment ARN of a user.
[$sel:enrollmentId:UserData'] :: UserData -> Maybe Text

-- | The email of a user.
[$sel:email:UserData'] :: UserData -> Maybe Text

-- | The enrollment status of a user.
[$sel:enrollmentStatus:UserData'] :: UserData -> Maybe EnrollmentStatus

-- | The last name of a user.
[$sel:lastName:UserData'] :: UserData -> Maybe Text

-- | The first name of a user.
[$sel:firstName:UserData'] :: UserData -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UserData</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userArn:UserData'</a>, <a>userData_userArn</a> - The ARN of a
--   user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enrollmentId:UserData'</a>, <a>userData_enrollmentId</a> - The
--   enrollment ARN of a user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:UserData'</a>, <a>userData_email</a> - The email of a
--   user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enrollmentStatus:UserData'</a>,
--   <a>userData_enrollmentStatus</a> - The enrollment status of a user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastName:UserData'</a>, <a>userData_lastName</a> - The last
--   name of a user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstName:UserData'</a>, <a>userData_firstName</a> - The first
--   name of a user.
newUserData :: UserData

-- | The ARN of a user.
userData_userArn :: Lens' UserData (Maybe Text)

-- | The enrollment ARN of a user.
userData_enrollmentId :: Lens' UserData (Maybe Text)

-- | The email of a user.
userData_email :: Lens' UserData (Maybe Text)

-- | The enrollment status of a user.
userData_enrollmentStatus :: Lens' UserData (Maybe EnrollmentStatus)

-- | The last name of a user.
userData_lastName :: Lens' UserData (Maybe Text)

-- | The first name of a user.
userData_firstName :: Lens' UserData (Maybe Text)

-- | Resets a device and its account to the known default settings. This
--   clears all information and settings set by previous users in the
--   following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Bluetooth - This unpairs all bluetooth devices paired with your
--   echo device.</li>
--   <li>Volume - This resets the echo device's volume to the default
--   value.</li>
--   <li>Notifications - This clears all notifications from your echo
--   device.</li>
--   <li>Lists - This clears all to-do items from your echo device.</li>
--   <li>Settings - This internally syncs the room's profile (if the device
--   is assigned to a room), contacts, address books, delegation access for
--   account linking, and communications (if enabled on the room
--   profile).</li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.StartDeviceSync

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartDeviceSync</a> smart constructor.
data StartDeviceSync
StartDeviceSync' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> [Feature] -> StartDeviceSync

-- | The ARN of the device to sync. Required.
[$sel:deviceArn:StartDeviceSync'] :: StartDeviceSync -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the room with which the device to sync is associated.
--   Required.
[$sel:roomArn:StartDeviceSync'] :: StartDeviceSync -> Maybe Text

-- | Request structure to start the device sync. Required.
[$sel:features:StartDeviceSync'] :: StartDeviceSync -> [Feature]

-- | Create a value of <a>StartDeviceSync</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceArn:StartDeviceSync'</a>,
--   <a>startDeviceSync_deviceArn</a> - The ARN of the device to sync.
--   Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomArn:StartDeviceSync'</a>, <a>startDeviceSync_roomArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the room with which the device to sync is associated.
--   Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:features:StartDeviceSync'</a>, <a>startDeviceSync_features</a>
--   - Request structure to start the device sync. Required.
newStartDeviceSync :: StartDeviceSync

-- | The ARN of the device to sync. Required.
startDeviceSync_deviceArn :: Lens' StartDeviceSync (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the room with which the device to sync is associated.
--   Required.
startDeviceSync_roomArn :: Lens' StartDeviceSync (Maybe Text)

-- | Request structure to start the device sync. Required.
startDeviceSync_features :: Lens' StartDeviceSync [Feature]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartDeviceSyncResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StartDeviceSyncResponse

-- | Triggers an asynchronous flow to send text, SSML, or audio
--   announcements to rooms that are identified by a search or filter.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.SendAnnouncement

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSendAnnouncement</a> smart constructor.
data SendAnnouncement
SendAnnouncement' :: Maybe Natural -> [Filter] -> Content -> Text -> SendAnnouncement

-- | The time to live for an announcement. Default is 300. If delivery
--   doesn't occur within this time, the announcement is not delivered.
[$sel:timeToLiveInSeconds:SendAnnouncement'] :: SendAnnouncement -> Maybe Natural

-- | The filters to use to send an announcement to a specified list of
--   rooms. The supported filter keys are RoomName, ProfileName, RoomArn,
--   and ProfileArn. To send to all rooms, specify an empty RoomFilters
--   list.
[$sel:roomFilters:SendAnnouncement'] :: SendAnnouncement -> [Filter]

-- | The announcement content. This can contain only one of the three
--   possible announcement types (text, SSML or audio).
[$sel:content:SendAnnouncement'] :: SendAnnouncement -> Content

-- | The unique, user-specified identifier for the request that ensures
--   idempotency.
[$sel:clientRequestToken:SendAnnouncement'] :: SendAnnouncement -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SendAnnouncement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLiveInSeconds:SendAnnouncement'</a>,
--   <a>sendAnnouncement_timeToLiveInSeconds</a> - The time to live for an
--   announcement. Default is 300. If delivery doesn't occur within this
--   time, the announcement is not delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomFilters:SendAnnouncement'</a>,
--   <a>sendAnnouncement_roomFilters</a> - The filters to use to send an
--   announcement to a specified list of rooms. The supported filter keys
--   are RoomName, ProfileName, RoomArn, and ProfileArn. To send to all
--   rooms, specify an empty RoomFilters list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:SendAnnouncement'</a>, <a>sendAnnouncement_content</a>
--   - The announcement content. This can contain only one of the three
--   possible announcement types (text, SSML or audio).
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:SendAnnouncement'</a>,
--   <a>sendAnnouncement_clientRequestToken</a> - The unique,
--   user-specified identifier for the request that ensures idempotency.
newSendAnnouncement :: Content -> Text -> SendAnnouncement

-- | The time to live for an announcement. Default is 300. If delivery
--   doesn't occur within this time, the announcement is not delivered.
sendAnnouncement_timeToLiveInSeconds :: Lens' SendAnnouncement (Maybe Natural)

-- | The filters to use to send an announcement to a specified list of
--   rooms. The supported filter keys are RoomName, ProfileName, RoomArn,
--   and ProfileArn. To send to all rooms, specify an empty RoomFilters
--   list.
sendAnnouncement_roomFilters :: Lens' SendAnnouncement [Filter]

-- | The announcement content. This can contain only one of the three
--   possible announcement types (text, SSML or audio).
sendAnnouncement_content :: Lens' SendAnnouncement Content

-- | The unique, user-specified identifier for the request that ensures
--   idempotency.
sendAnnouncement_clientRequestToken :: Lens' SendAnnouncement Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSendAnnouncementResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SendAnnouncementResponse
SendAnnouncementResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> SendAnnouncementResponse

-- | The identifier of the announcement.
[$sel:announcementArn:SendAnnouncementResponse'] :: SendAnnouncementResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SendAnnouncementResponse'] :: SendAnnouncementResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SendAnnouncementResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:announcementArn:SendAnnouncementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendAnnouncementResponse_announcementArn</a> - The identifier of
--   the announcement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SendAnnouncementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendAnnouncementResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newSendAnnouncementResponse :: Int -> SendAnnouncementResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.SendAnnouncement.SendAnnouncement


-- | Searches users and lists the ones that meet a set of filter and sort
--   criteria.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.SearchUsers

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchUsers</a> smart constructor.
data SearchUsers
SearchUsers' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Sort] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Filter] -> SearchUsers

-- | An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response includes only results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by <tt>MaxResults</tt>. Required.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchUsers'] :: SearchUsers -> Maybe Text

-- | The sort order to use in listing the filtered set of users. Required.
--   Supported sort keys are UserId, FirstName, LastName, Email, and
--   EnrollmentStatus.
[$sel:sortCriteria:SearchUsers'] :: SearchUsers -> Maybe [Sort]

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more
--   results exist than the specified <tt>MaxResults</tt> value, a token is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved. Required.
[$sel:maxResults:SearchUsers'] :: SearchUsers -> Maybe Natural

-- | The filters to use for listing a specific set of users. Required.
--   Supported filter keys are UserId, FirstName, LastName, Email, and
--   EnrollmentStatus.
[$sel:filters:SearchUsers'] :: SearchUsers -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | Searches devices and lists the ones that meet a set of filter
--   criteria.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.SearchDevices

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchDevices</a> smart constructor.
data SearchDevices
SearchDevices' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Sort] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Filter] -> SearchDevices

-- | An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response includes only results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by <tt>MaxResults</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchDevices'] :: SearchDevices -> Maybe Text

-- | The sort order to use in listing the specified set of devices.
--   Supported sort keys are DeviceName, DeviceStatus, RoomName,
--   DeviceType, DeviceSerialNumber, ConnectionStatus, NetworkProfileName,
--   NetworkProfileArn, Feature, and FailureCode.
[$sel:sortCriteria:SearchDevices'] :: SearchDevices -> Maybe [Sort]

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more
--   results exist than the specified <tt>MaxResults</tt> value, a token is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
[$sel:maxResults:SearchDevices'] :: SearchDevices -> Maybe Natural

-- | The filters to use to list a specified set of devices. Supported
--   filter keys are DeviceName, DeviceStatus, DeviceStatusDetailCode,
--   RoomName, DeviceType, DeviceSerialNumber, UnassociatedOnly,
--   ConnectionStatus (ONLINE and OFFLINE), NetworkProfileName,
--   NetworkProfileArn, Feature, and FailureCode.
[$sel:filters:SearchDevices'] :: SearchDevices -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchDevices</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response includes only results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by <tt>MaxResults</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortCriteria:SearchDevices'</a>,
--   <a>searchDevices_sortCriteria</a> - The sort order to use in listing
--   the specified set of devices. Supported sort keys are DeviceName,
--   DeviceStatus, RoomName, DeviceType, DeviceSerialNumber,
--   ConnectionStatus, NetworkProfileName, NetworkProfileArn, Feature, and
--   FailureCode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:SearchDevices'</a>, <a>searchDevices_maxResults</a>
--   - The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more
--   results exist than the specified <tt>MaxResults</tt> value, a token is

--   a prior request. Use this token for pagination of results from this
--   action. If this parameter is specified, the response only includes
--   results beyond the token, up to the value specified by MaxResults.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortCriteria:SearchAddressBooks'</a>,
--   <a>searchAddressBooks_sortCriteria</a> - The sort order to use in
--   listing the specified set of address books. The supported sort key is
--   AddressBookName.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:SearchAddressBooks'</a>,
--   <a>searchAddressBooks_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to include in the response. If more results exist than the specified
--   MaxResults value, a token is included in the response so that the
--   remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:SearchAddressBooks'</a>,
--   <a>searchAddressBooks_filters</a> - The filters to use to list a
--   specified set of address books. The supported filter key is
--   AddressBookName.
newSearchAddressBooks :: SearchAddressBooks

-- | An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response only includes results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by MaxResults.
searchAddressBooks_nextToken :: Lens' SearchAddressBooks (Maybe Text)

-- | The sort order to use in listing the specified set of address books.
--   The supported sort key is AddressBookName.
searchAddressBooks_sortCriteria :: Lens' SearchAddressBooks (Maybe [Sort])

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more
--   results exist than the specified MaxResults value, a token is included
--   in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.
searchAddressBooks_maxResults :: Lens' SearchAddressBooks (Maybe Natural)

-- | The filters to use to list a specified set of address books. The
--   supported filter key is AddressBookName.
searchAddressBooks_filters :: Lens' SearchAddressBooks (Maybe [Filter])

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchAddressBooksResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SearchAddressBooksResponse
SearchAddressBooksResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [AddressBookData] -> Maybe Int -> Int -> SearchAddressBooksResponse

-- | The token returned to indicate that there is more data available.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchAddressBooksResponse'] :: SearchAddressBooksResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The address books that meet the specified set of filter criteria, in
--   sort order.
[$sel:addressBooks:SearchAddressBooksResponse'] :: SearchAddressBooksResponse -> Maybe [AddressBookData]

-- | The total number of address books returned.
[$sel:totalCount:SearchAddressBooksResponse'] :: SearchAddressBooksResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SearchAddressBooksResponse'] :: SearchAddressBooksResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchAddressBooksResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:SearchAddressBooks'</a>,
--   <a>searchAddressBooksResponse_nextToken</a> - The token returned to
--   indicate that there is more data available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addressBooks:SearchAddressBooksResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchAddressBooksResponse_addressBooks</a> - The address books
--   that meet the specified set of filter criteria, in sort order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalCount:SearchAddressBooksResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchAddressBooksResponse_totalCount</a> - The total number of
--   address books returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SearchAddressBooksResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchAddressBooksResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newSearchAddressBooksResponse :: Int -> SearchAddressBooksResponse

-- | The token returned to indicate that there is more data available.
searchAddressBooksResponse_nextToken :: Lens' SearchAddressBooksResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The address books that meet the specified set of filter criteria, in
--   sort order.
searchAddressBooksResponse_addressBooks :: Lens' SearchAddressBooksResponse (Maybe [AddressBookData])

-- | The total number of address books returned.
searchAddressBooksResponse_totalCount :: Lens' SearchAddressBooksResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The response's http status code.
searchAddressBooksResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SearchAddressBooksResponse Int

-- | Determines the details for the room from which a skill request was
--   invoked. This operation is used by skill developers.
--   
--   To query ResolveRoom from an Alexa skill, the skill ID needs to be
--   authorized. When the skill is using an AWS Lambda function, the skill
--   is automatically authorized when you publish your skill as a private
--   skill to your AWS account. Skills that are hosted using a custom web
--   service must be manually authorized. To get your skill authorized,
--   contact AWS Support with your AWS account ID that queries the
--   ResolveRoom API and skill ID.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.ResolveRoom

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newResolveRoom</a> smart constructor.
data ResolveRoom
ResolveRoom' :: Text -> Text -> ResolveRoom

-- | The ARN of the user. Required.
[$sel:userId:ResolveRoom'] :: ResolveRoom -> Text

-- | The ARN of the skill that was requested. Required.
[$sel:skillId:ResolveRoom'] :: ResolveRoom -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResolveRoom</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userId:ResolveRoom'</a>, <a>resolveRoom_userId</a> - The ARN
--   of the user. Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:skillId:ResolveRoom'</a>, <a>resolveRoom_skillId</a> - The ARN
--   of the skill that was requested. Required.
newResolveRoom :: Text -> Text -> ResolveRoom

-- | The ARN of the user. Required.
resolveRoom_userId :: Lens' ResolveRoom Text

-- | The ARN of the skill that was requested. Required.
resolveRoom_skillId :: Lens' ResolveRoom Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newResolveRoomResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ResolveRoomResponse
ResolveRoomResponse' :: Maybe [RoomSkillParameter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ResolveRoomResponse

-- | Response to get the room profile request. Required.
[$sel:roomSkillParameters:ResolveRoomResponse'] :: ResolveRoomResponse -> Maybe [RoomSkillParameter]

-- | The ARN of the room from which the skill request was invoked.
[$sel:roomArn:ResolveRoomResponse'] :: ResolveRoomResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the room from which the skill request was invoked.
[$sel:roomName:ResolveRoomResponse'] :: ResolveRoomResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ResolveRoomResponse'] :: ResolveRoomResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ResolveRoomResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   room profile request. Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomArn:ResolveRoomResponse'</a>,
--   <a>resolveRoomResponse_roomArn</a> - The ARN of the room from which
--   the skill request was invoked.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomName:ResolveRoomResponse'</a>,
--   <a>resolveRoomResponse_roomName</a> - The name of the room from which
--   the skill request was invoked.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ResolveRoomResponse'</a>,
--   <a>resolveRoomResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newResolveRoomResponse :: Int -> ResolveRoomResponse

-- | Response to get the room profile request. Required.
resolveRoomResponse_roomSkillParameters :: Lens' ResolveRoomResponse (Maybe [RoomSkillParameter])

-- | The ARN of the room from which the skill request was invoked.
resolveRoomResponse_roomArn :: Lens' ResolveRoomResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the room from which the skill request was invoked.
resolveRoomResponse_roomName :: Lens' ResolveRoomResponse (Maybe Text)

resolveRoomResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ResolveRoomResponse Int

-- | Disassociates a skill from the organization under a user's AWS
--   account. If the skill is a private skill, it moves to an AcceptStatus
--   of PENDING. Any private or public skill that is rejected can be added
--   later by calling the ApproveSkill API.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.RejectSkill

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   unique identifier of the skill.

-- | Registers an Alexa-enabled device built by an Original Equipment
--   Manufacturer (OEM) using Alexa Voice Service (AVS).
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.RegisterAVSDevice

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterAVSDevice</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterAVSDevice
RegisterAVSDevice' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RegisterAVSDevice

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the room with which to associate
--   your AVS device.
[$sel:roomArn:RegisterAVSDevice'] :: RegisterAVSDevice -> Maybe Text

-- | The tags to be added to the specified resource. Do not provide system
--   tags.
[$sel:tags:RegisterAVSDevice'] :: RegisterAVSDevice -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The key generated by the OEM that uniquely identifies a specified
--   instance of your AVS device.
[$sel:deviceSerialNumber:RegisterAVSDevice'] :: RegisterAVSDevice -> Maybe Text

-- | The client ID of the OEM used for code-based linking authorization on
--   an AVS device.
[$sel:clientId:RegisterAVSDevice'] :: RegisterAVSDevice -> Text

-- | The code that is obtained after your AVS device has made a POST
--   request to LWA as a part of the Device Authorization Request component
--   of the OAuth code-based linking specification.
[$sel:userCode:RegisterAVSDevice'] :: RegisterAVSDevice -> Text

-- | The product ID used to identify your AVS device during authorization.
[$sel:productId:RegisterAVSDevice'] :: RegisterAVSDevice -> Text

-- | The device type ID for your AVS device generated by Amazon when the
--   OEM creates a new product on Amazon's Developer Console.
[$sel:amazonId:RegisterAVSDevice'] :: RegisterAVSDevice -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterAVSDevice</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomArn:RegisterAVSDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerAVSDevice_roomArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the room with which to associate your AVS device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RegisterAVSDevice'</a>, <a>registerAVSDevice_tags</a> -
--   The tags to be added to the specified resource. Do not provide system
--   tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceSerialNumber:RegisterAVSDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerAVSDevice_deviceSerialNumber</a> - The key generated by the
--   OEM that uniquely identifies a specified instance of your AVS device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientId:RegisterAVSDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerAVSDevice_clientId</a> - The client ID of the OEM used for
--   code-based linking authorization on an AVS device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userCode:RegisterAVSDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerAVSDevice_userCode</a> - The code that is obtained after
--   your AVS device has made a POST request to LWA as a part of the Device
--   Authorization Request component of the OAuth code-based linking
--   specification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:RegisterAVSDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerAVSDevice_productId</a> - The product ID used to identify
--   your AVS device during authorization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:amazonId:RegisterAVSDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerAVSDevice_amazonId</a> - The device type ID for your AVS
--   device generated by Amazon when the OEM creates a new product on
--   Amazon's Developer Console.
newRegisterAVSDevice :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RegisterAVSDevice

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the room with which to associate
--   your AVS device.
registerAVSDevice_roomArn :: Lens' RegisterAVSDevice (Maybe Text)

--   tags.

--   instance of your AVS device.
registerAVSDevice_deviceSerialNumber :: Lens' RegisterAVSDevice (Maybe Text)

-- | The client ID of the OEM used for code-based linking authorization on
--   an AVS device.
registerAVSDevice_clientId :: Lens' RegisterAVSDevice Text

-- | The code that is obtained after your AVS device has made a POST
--   request to LWA as a part of the Device Authorization Request component
--   of the OAuth code-based linking specification.
registerAVSDevice_userCode :: Lens' RegisterAVSDevice Text

-- | The product ID used to identify your AVS device during authorization.
registerAVSDevice_productId :: Lens' RegisterAVSDevice Text

-- | The device type ID for your AVS device generated by Amazon when the
--   OEM creates a new product on Amazon's Developer Console.
registerAVSDevice_amazonId :: Lens' RegisterAVSDevice Text

-- | Links a user's account to a third-party skill provider. If this API
--   operation is called by an assumed IAM role, the skill being linked
--   must be a private skill. Also, the skill must be owned by the AWS
--   account that assumed the IAM role.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.PutSkillAuthorization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutSkillAuthorization</a> smart constructor.
data PutSkillAuthorization
PutSkillAuthorization' :: Maybe Text -> Sensitive (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> PutSkillAuthorization

-- | The room that the skill is authorized for.
[$sel:roomArn:PutSkillAuthorization'] :: PutSkillAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The authorization result specific to OAUTH code grant output. "Codeâ€
--   must be populated in the AuthorizationResult map to establish the
--   authorization.
[$sel:authorizationResult:PutSkillAuthorization'] :: PutSkillAuthorization -> Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The unique identifier of a skill.
[$sel:skillId:PutSkillAuthorization'] :: PutSkillAuthorization -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutSkillAuthorization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   authorized for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizationResult:PutSkillAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>putSkillAuthorization_authorizationResult</a> - The authorization
--   result specific to OAUTH code grant output. "Codeâ€ must be populated
--   in the AuthorizationResult map to establish the authorization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:skillId:PutSkillAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>putSkillAuthorization_skillId</a> - The unique identifier of a
--   skill.

--   authorization.

-- | Lists all tags for the specified resource.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.ListTags

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTags</a> smart constructor.
data ListTags
ListTags' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListTags

-- | An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response includes only results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by <tt>MaxResults</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTags'] :: ListTags -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more
--   results exist than the specified <tt>MaxResults</tt> value, a token is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
[$sel:maxResults:ListTags'] :: ListTags -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ARN of the specified resource for which to list tags.

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTags</a> with all optional fields omitted.

--   maximum number of results to include in the response. If more results
--   exist than the specified <tt>MaxResults</tt> value, a token is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
--

--   specified resource for which to list tags.

--   specified, the response includes only results beyond the token, up to

-- | Lists all enabled skills in a specific skill group.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.ListSkills

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListSkills</a> smart constructor.
data ListSkills
ListSkills' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SkillTypeFilter -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EnablementTypeFilter -> ListSkills

-- | An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response includes only results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by <tt>MaxResults</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListSkills'] :: ListSkills -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more
--   results exist than the specified <tt>MaxResults</tt> value, a token is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
[$sel:maxResults:ListSkills'] :: ListSkills -> Maybe Natural

-- | Whether the skill is publicly available or is a private skill.
[$sel:skillType:ListSkills'] :: ListSkills -> Maybe SkillTypeFilter

-- | The ARN of the skill group for which to list enabled skills.
[$sel:skillGroupArn:ListSkills'] :: ListSkills -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether the skill is enabled under the user's account.
[$sel:enablementType:ListSkills'] :: ListSkills -> Maybe EnablementTypeFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ListSkills</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response includes only results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by <tt>MaxResults</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListSkills'</a>, <a>listSkills_maxResults</a> - The
--   maximum number of results to include in the response. If more results
--   exist than the specified <tt>MaxResults</tt> value, a token is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:skillType:ListSkills'</a>, <a>listSkills_skillType</a> -
--   Whether the skill is publicly available or is a private skill.

--   - The ARN of the skill group for which to list enabled skills.

-- | Retrieves a list of gateway summaries. Use GetGateway to retrieve
--   details of a specific gateway. An optional gateway group ARN can be
--   provided to only retrieve gateway summaries of gateways that are
--   associated with that gateway group ARN.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.ListGateways

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListGateways</a> smart constructor.
data ListGateways

-- | The token used to paginate though multiple pages of gateway summaries.

-- | The maximum number of gateway summaries to return. The default is 50.
[$sel:maxResults:ListGateways'] :: ListGateways -> Maybe Natural

-- | Retrieves a list of gateway group summaries. Use GetGatewayGroup to
--   retrieve details of a specific gateway group.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.ListGatewayGroups

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListGatewayGroups</a> smart constructor.
data ListGatewayGroups
ListGatewayGroups' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListGatewayGroups

-- | The token used to paginate though multiple pages of gateway group
--   summaries.
[$sel:nextToken:ListGatewayGroups'] :: ListGatewayGroups -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of gateway group summaries to return. The default
--   is 50.
[$sel:maxResults:ListGatewayGroups'] :: ListGatewayGroups -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListGatewayGroups</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListGatewayGroups'</a>,
--   <a>listGatewayGroups_nextToken</a> - The token used to paginate though
--   multiple pages of gateway group summaries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListGatewayGroups'</a>,
--   <a>listGatewayGroups_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of gateway
--   group summaries to return. The default is 50.
newListGatewayGroups :: ListGatewayGroups

-- | The token used to paginate though multiple pages of gateway group
--   summaries.
listGatewayGroups_nextToken :: Lens' ListGatewayGroups (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of gateway group summaries to return. The default
--   is 50.
listGatewayGroups_maxResults :: Lens' ListGatewayGroups (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListGatewayGroupsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListGatewayGroupsResponse
ListGatewayGroupsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [GatewayGroupSummary] -> Int -> ListGatewayGroupsResponse

-- | The token used to paginate though multiple pages of gateway group
--   summaries.
[$sel:nextToken:ListGatewayGroupsResponse'] :: ListGatewayGroupsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The gateway groups in the list.
[$sel:gatewayGroups:ListGatewayGroupsResponse'] :: ListGatewayGroupsResponse -> Maybe [GatewayGroupSummary]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListGatewayGroupsResponse'] :: ListGatewayGroupsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListGatewayGroupsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   paginate though multiple pages of gateway group summaries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayGroups:ListGatewayGroupsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listGatewayGroupsResponse_gatewayGroups</a> - The gateway groups in
--   the list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListGatewayGroupsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listGatewayGroupsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

-- | Lists the device event history, including device connection status,
--   for up to 30 days.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.ListDeviceEvents

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListDeviceEvents</a> smart constructor.
data ListDeviceEvents
ListDeviceEvents' :: Maybe DeviceEventType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListDeviceEvents

-- | The event type to filter device events. If EventType isn't specified,
--   this returns a list of all device events in reverse chronological
--   order. If EventType is specified, this returns a list of device events
--   for that EventType in reverse chronological order.
[$sel:eventType:ListDeviceEvents'] :: ListDeviceEvents -> Maybe DeviceEventType

-- | An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response only includes results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by MaxResults. When the end of results is reached,
--   the response has a value of null.
[$sel:nextToken:ListDeviceEvents'] :: ListDeviceEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response. The default
--   value is 50. If more results exist than the specified MaxResults
--   value, a token is included in the response so that the remaining
--   results can be retrieved.
[$sel:maxResults:ListDeviceEvents'] :: ListDeviceEvents -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ARN of a device.
[$sel:deviceArn:ListDeviceEvents'] :: ListDeviceEvents -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListDeviceEvents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:ListDeviceEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listDeviceEvents_eventType</a> - The event type to filter device
--   events. If EventType isn't specified, this returns a list of all
--   device events in reverse chronological order. If EventType is
--   specified, this returns a list of device events for that EventType in
--   reverse chronological order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListDeviceEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listDeviceEvents_nextToken</a> - An optional token returned from a
--   prior request. Use this token for pagination of results from this
--   action. If this parameter is specified, the response only includes
--   results beyond the token, up to the value specified by MaxResults.
--   When the end of results is reached, the response has a value of null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListDeviceEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listDeviceEvents_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   include in the response. The default value is 50. If more results
--   exist than the specified MaxResults value, a token is included in the
--   response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceArn:ListDeviceEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listDeviceEvents_deviceArn</a> - The ARN of a device.
newListDeviceEvents :: Text -> ListDeviceEvents

-- | The event type to filter device events. If EventType isn't specified,
--   this returns a list of all device events in reverse chronological
--   order. If EventType is specified, this returns a list of device events
--   for that EventType in reverse chronological order.
listDeviceEvents_eventType :: Lens' ListDeviceEvents (Maybe DeviceEventType)

-- | An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for
--   pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response only includes results beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by MaxResults. When the end of results is reached,
--   the response has a value of null.
listDeviceEvents_nextToken :: Lens' ListDeviceEvents (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response. The default
--   value is 50. If more results exist than the specified MaxResults
--   value, a token is included in the response so that the remaining
--   results can be retrieved.
listDeviceEvents_maxResults :: Lens' ListDeviceEvents (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ARN of a device.
listDeviceEvents_deviceArn :: Lens' ListDeviceEvents Text

-- | Lists the details of the schedules that a user configured. A download
--   URL of the report associated with each schedule is returned every time
--   this action is called. A new download URL is returned each time, and
--   is valid for 24 hours.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.ListBusinessReportSchedules

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBusinessReportSchedules</a> smart constructor.
data ListBusinessReportSchedules
ListBusinessReportSchedules' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListBusinessReportSchedules

-- | The token used to list the remaining schedules from the previous API
--   call.
[$sel:nextToken:ListBusinessReportSchedules'] :: ListBusinessReportSchedules -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of schedules listed in the call.
[$sel:maxResults:ListBusinessReportSchedules'] :: ListBusinessReportSchedules -> Maybe Natural

--   the remaining schedules from the previous API call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListBusinessReportSchedules'</a>,
--   <a>listBusinessReportSchedules_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   schedules listed in the call.
newListBusinessReportSchedules :: ListBusinessReportSchedules

-- | The token used to list the remaining schedules from the previous API
--   call.
listBusinessReportSchedules_nextToken :: Lens' ListBusinessReportSchedules (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of schedules listed in the call.
listBusinessReportSchedules_maxResults :: Lens' ListBusinessReportSchedules (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse
ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [BusinessReportSchedule] -> Int -> ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse

-- | The token used to list the remaining schedules from the previous API
--   call.
[$sel:nextToken:ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse'] :: ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The schedule of the reports.
[$sel:businessReportSchedules:ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse'] :: ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse -> Maybe [BusinessReportSchedule]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse'] :: ListBusinessReportSchedulesResponse -> Int

-- | Disassociates a skill group from a specified room. This disables all
--   skills in the skill group on all devices in the room.

--   constructor.

--   <a>$sel:skillGroupArn:DisassociateSkillGroupFromRoom'</a>,

--   skill group to disassociate from a room. Required.

--   authorized users to delete the device's entire previous history of
--   voice input data and associated response data. This action can be
--   called once every 24 hours for a specific shared device.

--   idempotency.

[$sel:lastName:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The first name for the user.
[$sel:firstName:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Maybe Text

-- | Creates a room with the specified details.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.CreateRoom

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRoom</a> smart constructor.
data CreateRoom

-- | The tags for the room.

-- | The profile ARN for the room. This is required.

-- | The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS
--   Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the
--   devices.
[$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:CreateNetworkProfile'] :: CreateNetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

--   on your devices and used to trust your authentication server during
--   EAP negotiation.

-- | The authentication standard that is used in the EAP framework.
--   Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
[$sel:eapMethod:CreateNetworkProfile'] :: CreateNetworkProfile -> Maybe NetworkEapMethod

--   tags.
[$sel:tags:CreateNetworkProfile'] :: CreateNetworkProfile -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.
[$sel:description:CreateNetworkProfile'] :: CreateNetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The next, or subsequent, password of the Wi-Fi network. This password
--   is asynchronously transmitted to the device and is used when the
--   password of the network changes to NextPassword.
[$sel:nextPassword:CreateNetworkProfile'] :: CreateNetworkProfile -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileName:CreateNetworkProfile'] :: CreateNetworkProfile -> Text

-- | The SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
[$sel:ssid:CreateNetworkProfile'] :: CreateNetworkProfile -> Text

-- | The security type of the Wi-Fi network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE,
--   WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or OPEN.
[$sel:securityType:CreateNetworkProfile'] :: CreateNetworkProfile -> NetworkSecurityType

-- | Creates a contact with the specified details.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.CreateContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContact</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContact
CreateContact' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [PhoneNumber] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [SipAddress] -> Text -> CreateContact

-- | The phone number of the contact in E.164 format. The phone number type
--   defaults to WORK. You can specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We
--   recommend that you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone
--   number type and multiple numbers.
[$sel:phoneNumber:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The list of phone numbers for the contact.
[$sel:phoneNumbers:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe [PhoneNumber]

-- | The tags to be added to the specified resource. Do not provide system
--   tags.
[$sel:tags:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A unique, user-specified identifier for this request that ensures
--   idempotency.
[$sel:clientRequestToken:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The last name of the contact that is used to call the contact on the
--   device.
[$sel:lastName:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the contact to display on the console.
[$sel:displayName:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of SIP addresses for the contact.
[$sel:sipAddresses:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe [SipAddress]

-- | The first name of the contact that is used to call the contact on the
--   device.
[$sel:firstName:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Text

--   omitted.

--   contact.

-- | Creates a recurring schedule for usage reports to deliver to the
--   specified S3 location with a specified daily or weekly interval.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.CreateBusinessReportSchedule

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBusinessReportSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBusinessReportSchedule
CreateBusinessReportSchedule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BusinessReportRecurrence -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BusinessReportFormat -> BusinessReportContentRange -> CreateBusinessReportSchedule

-- | The S3 key where the report is delivered.
[$sel:s3KeyPrefix:CreateBusinessReportSchedule'] :: CreateBusinessReportSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The recurrence of the reports. If this isn't specified, the report
--   will only be delivered one time when the API is called.
[$sel:recurrence:CreateBusinessReportSchedule'] :: CreateBusinessReportSchedule -> Maybe BusinessReportRecurrence

-- | The tags for the business report schedule.
[$sel:tags:CreateBusinessReportSchedule'] :: CreateBusinessReportSchedule -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The S3 bucket name of the output reports. If this isn't specified, the
--   report can be retrieved from a download link by calling
--   ListBusinessReportSchedule.
[$sel:s3BucketName:CreateBusinessReportSchedule'] :: CreateBusinessReportSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The client request token.
[$sel:clientRequestToken:CreateBusinessReportSchedule'] :: CreateBusinessReportSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The name identifier of the schedule.
[$sel:scheduleName:CreateBusinessReportSchedule'] :: CreateBusinessReportSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The format of the generated report (individual CSV files or zipped
--   files of individual files).
[$sel:format:CreateBusinessReportSchedule'] :: CreateBusinessReportSchedule -> BusinessReportFormat

-- | The content range of the reports.
[$sel:contentRange:CreateBusinessReportSchedule'] :: CreateBusinessReportSchedule -> BusinessReportContentRange

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBusinessReportSchedule</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | Associates a device with a given room. This applies all the settings
--   from the room profile to the device, and all the skills in any skill
--   groups added to that room. This operation requires the device to be
--   online, or else a manual sync is required.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.AssociateDeviceWithRoom

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateDeviceWithRoom</a> smart constructor.

--   associate to a room. Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomArn:AssociateDeviceWithRoom'</a>,
--   <a>associateDeviceWithRoom_roomArn</a> - The ARN of the room with
--   which to associate the device. Required.

-- | Associates a skill with the organization under the customer's AWS
--   account. If a skill is private, the user implicitly accepts access to
--   this skill during enablement.

-- | Removes metadata tags from a specified resource.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The ARN of the resource from which to remove metadata tags. Required.
[$sel:arn:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The tags to be removed from the specified resource. Do not provide
--   system tags. Required.
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_arn</a> - The ARN of
--   the resource from which to remove metadata tags. Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   tags to be removed from the specified resource. Do not provide system
--   tags. Required.
newUntagResource :: Text -> UntagResource

-- | The ARN of the resource from which to remove metadata tags. Required.
untagResource_arn :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The tags to be removed from the specified resource. Do not provide
--   system tags. Required.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | Updates the contact details by the contact ARN.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.UpdateContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContact</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContact
UpdateContact' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [PhoneNumber] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [SipAddress] -> Text -> UpdateContact

-- | The updated phone number of the contact. The phone number type
--   defaults to WORK. You can either specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers.
--   We recommend that you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the
--   phone number type and multiple numbers.
[$sel:phoneNumber:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The list of phone numbers for the contact.
[$sel:phoneNumbers:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Maybe [PhoneNumber]

-- | The updated last name of the contact.
[$sel:lastName:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The updated first name of the contact.
[$sel:firstName:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The updated display name of the contact.
[$sel:displayName:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of SIP addresses for the contact.
[$sel:sipAddresses:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Maybe [SipAddress]

-- | The ARN of the contact to update.
[$sel:contactArn:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:UpdateContact'</a>,
--   <a>updateContact_phoneNumber</a> - The updated phone number of the
--   contact. The phone number type defaults to WORK. You can either
--   specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We recommend that you use
--   PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone number type and
--   multiple numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumbers:UpdateContact'</a>,
--   <a>updateContact_phoneNumbers</a> - The list of phone numbers for the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastName:UpdateContact'</a>, <a>updateContact_lastName</a> -
--   The updated last name of the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstName:UpdateContact'</a>, <a>updateContact_firstName</a> -
--   The updated first name of the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:UpdateContact'</a>,
--   <a>updateContact_displayName</a> - The updated display name of the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sipAddresses:UpdateContact'</a>,
--   <a>updateContact_sipAddresses</a> - The list of SIP addresses for the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:UpdateContact'</a>, <a>updateContact_contactArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the contact to update.
newUpdateContact :: Text -> UpdateContact

-- | The updated phone number of the contact. The phone number type
--   defaults to WORK. You can either specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers.
--   We recommend that you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the
--   phone number type and multiple numbers.
updateContact_phoneNumber :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of phone numbers for the contact.
updateContact_phoneNumbers :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe [PhoneNumber])

-- | The updated last name of the contact.
updateContact_lastName :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The updated first name of the contact.
updateContact_firstName :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The updated display name of the contact.
updateContact_displayName :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of SIP addresses for the contact.
updateContact_sipAddresses :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe [SipAddress])

-- | The ARN of the contact to update.
updateContact_contactArn :: Lens' UpdateContact Text

-- | Updates a network profile by the network profile ARN.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.UpdateNetworkProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateNetworkProfile</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateNetworkProfile
UpdateNetworkProfile' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Text -> UpdateNetworkProfile

-- | The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS
--   Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the
--   devices.
[$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:UpdateNetworkProfile'] :: UpdateNetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The root certificate(s) of your authentication server that will be
--   installed on your devices and used to trust your authentication server
--   during EAP negotiation.
[$sel:trustAnchors:UpdateNetworkProfile'] :: UpdateNetworkProfile -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The current password of the Wi-Fi network.
[$sel:currentPassword:UpdateNetworkProfile'] :: UpdateNetworkProfile -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileName:UpdateNetworkProfile'] :: UpdateNetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.
[$sel:description:UpdateNetworkProfile'] :: UpdateNetworkProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The next, or subsequent, password of the Wi-Fi network. This password
--   is asynchronously transmitted to the device and is used when the
--   password of the network changes to NextPassword.
[$sel:nextPassword:UpdateNetworkProfile'] :: UpdateNetworkProfile -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The ARN of the network profile associated with a device.
[$sel:networkProfileArn:UpdateNetworkProfile'] :: UpdateNetworkProfile -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateNetworkProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:UpdateNetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateNetworkProfile_certificateAuthorityArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS Certificate Manager
--   (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trustAnchors:UpdateNetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateNetworkProfile_trustAnchors</a> - The root certificate(s) of
--   your authentication server that will be installed on your devices and
--   used to trust your authentication server during EAP negotiation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentPassword:UpdateNetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateNetworkProfile_currentPassword</a> - The current password of
--   the Wi-Fi network.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileName:UpdateNetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateNetworkProfile_networkProfileName</a> - The name of the
--   network profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateNetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateNetworkProfile_description</a> - Detailed information about a
--   device's network profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPassword:UpdateNetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateNetworkProfile_nextPassword</a> - The next, or subsequent,
--   password of the Wi-Fi network. This password is asynchronously
--   transmitted to the device and is used when the password of the network
--   changes to NextPassword.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileArn:UpdateNetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateNetworkProfile_networkProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
newUpdateNetworkProfile :: Text -> UpdateNetworkProfile

-- | The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS
--   Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the
--   devices.
updateNetworkProfile_certificateAuthorityArn :: Lens' UpdateNetworkProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The root certificate(s) of your authentication server that will be
--   installed on your devices and used to trust your authentication server
--   during EAP negotiation.
updateNetworkProfile_trustAnchors :: Lens' UpdateNetworkProfile (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

updateNetworkProfile_currentPassword :: Lens' UpdateNetworkProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the network profile associated with a device.

-- | Detailed information about a device's network profile.

--   password of the network changes to NextPassword.
