-- | Updates an existing room profile by room profile ARN.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.UpdateProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProfile</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateProfile
UpdateProfile' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TemperatureUnit -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe WakeWord -> Maybe Text -> Maybe UpdateMeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DistanceUnit -> UpdateProfile

-- | The updated name for the room profile.
[$sel:profileName:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the profile as default if selected. If this is missing, no update
--   is done to the default status.
[$sel:isDefault:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The updated address for the room profile.
[$sel:address:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The updated locale for the room profile. (This is currently only
--   available to a limited preview audience.)
[$sel:locale:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The updated temperature unit for the room profile.
[$sel:temperatureUnit:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe TemperatureUnit

-- | Whether the PSTN setting of the room profile is enabled.
[$sel:pSTNEnabled:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | Whether the setup mode of the profile is enabled.
[$sel:setupModeDisabled:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The updated maximum volume limit for the room profile.
[$sel:maxVolumeLimit:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Int

-- | The updated wake word for the room profile.
[$sel:wakeWord:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe WakeWord

-- | The ARN of the room profile to update. Required.
[$sel:profileArn:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The updated meeting room settings of a room profile.
[$sel:meetingRoomConfiguration:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe UpdateMeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | The updated timezone for the room profile.
[$sel:timezone:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether data retention of the profile is enabled.
[$sel:dataRetentionOptIn:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The updated distance unit for the room profile.
[$sel:distanceUnit:UpdateProfile'] :: UpdateProfile -> Maybe DistanceUnit

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:profileName:UpdateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateProfile_profileName</a> - The updated name for the room
--   profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefault:UpdateProfile'</a>, <a>updateProfile_isDefault</a> -
--   Sets the profile as default if selected. If this is missing, no update
--   is done to the default status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:UpdateProfile'</a>, <a>updateProfile_address</a> - The
--   updated address for the room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:UpdateProfile'</a>, <a>updateProfile_locale</a> - The
--   updated locale for the room profile. (This is currently only available
--   to a limited preview audience.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:temperatureUnit:UpdateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateProfile_temperatureUnit</a> - The updated temperature unit
--   for the room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pSTNEnabled:UpdateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateProfile_pSTNEnabled</a> - Whether the PSTN setting of the
--   room profile is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:setupModeDisabled:UpdateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateProfile_setupModeDisabled</a> - Whether the setup mode of the
--   profile is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxVolumeLimit:UpdateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateProfile_maxVolumeLimit</a> - The updated maximum volume limit
--   for the room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:wakeWord:UpdateProfile'</a>, <a>updateProfile_wakeWord</a> -
--   The updated wake word for the room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:profileArn:UpdateProfile'</a>, <a>updateProfile_profileArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the room profile to update. Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:meetingRoomConfiguration:UpdateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateProfile_meetingRoomConfiguration</a> - The updated meeting
--   room settings of a room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:UpdateProfile'</a>, <a>updateProfile_timezone</a> -
--   The updated timezone for the room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataRetentionOptIn:UpdateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateProfile_dataRetentionOptIn</a> - Whether data retention of
--   the profile is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:distanceUnit:UpdateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateProfile_distanceUnit</a> - The updated distance unit for the
--   room profile.
newUpdateProfile :: UpdateProfile

-- | The updated name for the room profile.
updateProfile_profileName :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the profile as default if selected. If this is missing, no update
--   is done to the default status.
updateProfile_isDefault :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | The updated address for the room profile.
updateProfile_address :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The updated locale for the room profile. (This is currently only
--   available to a limited preview audience.)
updateProfile_locale :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The updated temperature unit for the room profile.
updateProfile_temperatureUnit :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe TemperatureUnit)

-- | Whether the PSTN setting of the room profile is enabled.
updateProfile_pSTNEnabled :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether the setup mode of the profile is enabled.
updateProfile_setupModeDisabled :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | The updated maximum volume limit for the room profile.
updateProfile_maxVolumeLimit :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe Int)

-- | The updated wake word for the room profile.

updateProfile_dataRetentionOptIn :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | The updated distance unit for the room profile.
updateProfile_distanceUnit :: Lens' UpdateProfile (Maybe DistanceUnit)

deviceEvent_type :: Lens' DeviceEvent (Maybe DeviceEventType)

--   device.

endOfMeetingReminder_reminderAtMinutes :: Lens' EndOfMeetingReminder (Maybe (NonEmpty Int))

module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2017-11-09</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Alexa for Business helps you use Alexa in your organization. Alexa for
--   Business provides you with the tools to manage Alexa devices, enroll
--   your users, and assign skills, at scale. You can build your own
--   context-aware voice skills using the Alexa Skills Kit and the Alexa
--   for Business API operations. You can also make these available as
--   private skills for your organization. Alexa for Business makes it
--   efficient to voice-enable your products and services, thus providing
--   context-aware voice experiences for your customers. Device makers
--   building with the Alexa Voice Service (AVS) can create fully
--   integrated solutions, register their products with Alexa for Business,
--   and manage them as shared devices in their organization.
module Network.AWS.AlexaBusiness

-- | API version <tt>2017-11-09</tt> of the Amazon Alexa For Business SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The resource is not found.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The service linked role is locked for deletion.
_InvalidServiceLinkedRoleStateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The attempt to update a user is invalid due to the user's current
--   status.
_InvalidUserStatusException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The caller has no permissions to operate on the resource involved in
--   the API call.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Another resource is associated with the resource in the request.
_ResourceAssociatedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The Certificate Authority can't issue or revoke a certificate.
_InvalidCertificateAuthorityException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There is a concurrent modification of resources.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request failed because this device is no longer registered and
--   therefore no longer managed by this account.
_DeviceNotRegisteredException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The name sent in the request is already in use.
_NameInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource being created already exists.
_AlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are performing an action that would put you beyond your account's
--   limits.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource in the request is already in use.
_ResourceInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The device is in an invalid state.
_InvalidDeviceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The skill must be linked to a third-party account.
_SkillNotLinkedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A password in SecretsManager is in an invalid state.
_InvalidSecretsManagerResourceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartDeviceSync</a> smart constructor.
data StartDeviceSync
StartDeviceSync' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> [Feature] -> StartDeviceSync

-- | Create a value of <a>StartDeviceSync</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceArn:StartDeviceSync'</a>,
--   <a>startDeviceSync_deviceArn</a> - The ARN of the device to sync.
--   Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomArn:StartDeviceSync'</a>, <a>startDeviceSync_roomArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the room with which the device to sync is associated.
--   Required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:features:StartDeviceSync'</a>, <a>startDeviceSync_features</a>
--   - Request structure to start the device sync. Required.
newStartDeviceSync :: StartDeviceSync

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartDeviceSyncResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StartDeviceSyncResponse
StartDeviceSyncResponse' :: Int -> StartDeviceSyncResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>StartDeviceSyncResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StartDeviceSyncResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startDeviceSyncResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newStartDeviceSyncResponse :: Int -> StartDeviceSyncResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateProfile</a> smart constructor.
data CreateProfile
CreateProfile' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DistanceUnit -> TemperatureUnit -> WakeWord -> CreateProfile

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:CreateProfile'</a>, <a>createProfile_locale</a> - The
--   locale of the room profile. (This is currently only available to a
--   limited preview audience.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:pSTNEnabled:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_pSTNEnabled</a> - Whether PSTN calling is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:setupModeDisabled:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_setupModeDisabled</a> - Whether room profile setup is
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxVolumeLimit:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_maxVolumeLimit</a> - The maximum volume limit for a
--   room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateProfile'</a>, <a>createProfile_tags</a> - The tags
--   for the profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:meetingRoomConfiguration:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_meetingRoomConfiguration</a> - The meeting room
--   settings of a room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_clientRequestToken</a> - The user-specified token
--   that is used during the creation of a profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataRetentionOptIn:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_dataRetentionOptIn</a> - Whether data retention of
--   the profile is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:profileName:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_profileName</a> - The name of a room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:CreateProfile'</a>, <a>createProfile_timezone</a> -
--   The time zone used by a room profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:CreateProfile'</a>, <a>createProfile_address</a> - The
--   valid address for the room.
--   
--   <a>$sel:distanceUnit:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_distanceUnit</a> - The distance unit to be used by
--   devices in the profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:temperatureUnit:CreateProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createProfile_temperatureUnit</a> - The temperature unit to be used
--   by devices in the profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:wakeWord:CreateProfile'</a>, <a>createProfile_wakeWord</a> - A
--   wake word for Alexa, Echo, Amazon, or a computer.

-- | The audio message. There is a 1 MB limit on the audio file input and
--   the only supported format is MP3. To convert your MP3 audio files to
--   an Alexa-friendly,
--   
--   required codec version (MPEG version 2) and bit rate (48 kbps), you
--   might use converter software. One option for this is a command-line
--   tool, FFmpeg. For more information, see <a>FFmpeg</a>. The following
--   command converts the provided &lt;input-file&gt; to an MP3 file that
--   is played in the announcement:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ffmpeg -i &lt;input-file&gt; -ac 2 -codec:a libmp3lame -b:a 48k -ar 16000 &lt;output-file.mp3&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudio</a> smart constructor.
data Audio
Audio' :: Locale -> Text -> Audio

-- | Create a value of <a>Audio</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:Audio'</a>, <a>audio_locale</a> - The locale of the
--   audio message. Currently, en-US is supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Audio'</a>, <a>audio_location</a> - The location of
--   the audio file. Currently, S3 URLs are supported. Only S3 locations
--   comprised of safe characters are valid. For more information, see
--   <a>Safe Characters</a>.
newAudio :: Locale -> Text -> Audio

-- | An entity that provides a conferencing solution. Alexa for Business
--   acts as the voice interface and mediator that connects users to their

--   <a>conferenceProvider_iPDialIn</a> - The IP endpoint and protocol for
--   calling.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ConferenceProvider'</a>, <a>conferenceProvider_arn</a> -
--   The ARN of the newly created conference provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ConferenceProvider'</a>, <a>conferenceProvider_name</a> -

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_phoneNumber</a> - The
--   phone number of the contact. The phone number type defaults to WORK.
--   You can either specify PhoneNumber or PhoneNumbers. We recommend that
--   you use PhoneNumbers, which lets you specify the phone number type and
--   multiple numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumbers:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_phoneNumbers</a> - The
--   list of phone numbers for the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_lastName</a> - The last name
--   of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_firstName</a> - The first
--   name of the contact, used to call the contact on the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_contactArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_displayName</a> - The
--   name of the contact to display on the console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sipAddresses:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_sipAddresses</a> - The
--   list of SIP addresses for the contact.
newContact :: Contact

-- | Creates settings for the end of meeting reminder feature that are
--   applied to a room profile. The end of meeting reminder enables Alexa
--   to remind users when a meeting is ending.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateEndOfMeetingReminder</a> smart constructor.
data CreateEndOfMeetingReminder
CreateEndOfMeetingReminder' :: NonEmpty Int -> EndOfMeetingReminderType -> Bool -> CreateEndOfMeetingReminder

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateEndOfMeetingReminder</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reminderAtMinutes:CreateEndOfMeetingReminder'</a>,
--   <a>createEndOfMeetingReminder_reminderAtMinutes</a> - A range of 3 to
--   15 minutes that determines when the reminder begins.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reminderType:CreateEndOfMeetingReminder'</a>,
--   <a>createEndOfMeetingReminder_reminderType</a> - The type of sound
--   that users hear during the end of meeting reminder.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CreateEndOfMeetingReminder'</a>,
--   <a>createEndOfMeetingReminder_enabled</a> - Whether an end of meeting
--   reminder is enabled or not.
newCreateEndOfMeetingReminder :: NonEmpty Int -> EndOfMeetingReminderType -> Bool -> CreateEndOfMeetingReminder

-- | Creates settings for the instant booking feature that are applied to a
--   room profile. When users start their meeting with Alexa, Alexa
--   automatically books the room for the configured duration if the room
--   is available.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateInstantBooking</a> smart constructor.
data CreateInstantBooking
CreateInstantBooking' :: Int -> Bool -> CreateInstantBooking

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateInstantBooking</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInMinutes:CreateInstantBooking'</a>,
--   <a>createInstantBooking_durationInMinutes</a> - Duration between 15
--   and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that determines how long to book
--   an available room when a meeting is started with Alexa.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CreateInstantBooking'</a>,
--   <a>createInstantBooking_enabled</a> - Whether instant booking is
--   enabled or not.
newCreateInstantBooking :: Int -> Bool -> CreateInstantBooking

-- | Creates meeting room settings of a room profile.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateMeetingRoomConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration
CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe CreateEndOfMeetingReminder -> Maybe CreateInstantBooking -> Maybe CreateRequireCheckIn -> CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createMeetingRoomConfiguration_roomUtilizationMetricsEnabled</a> -
--   Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOfMeetingReminder:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createMeetingRoomConfiguration_endOfMeetingReminder</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instantBooking:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createMeetingRoomConfiguration_instantBooking</a> - Settings to
--   automatically book a room for a configured duration if it's free when
--   joining a meeting with Alexa.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireCheckIn:CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createMeetingRoomConfiguration_requireCheckIn</a> - Settings for
--   requiring a check in when a room is reserved. Alexa can cancel a room
--   reservation if it's not checked into to make the room available for
--   others. Users can check in by joining the meeting with Alexa or an AVS
--   device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
newCreateMeetingRoomConfiguration :: CreateMeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | Creates settings for the require check in feature that are applied to
--   a room profile. Require check in allows a meeting roomâ€™s Alexa or AVS
--   device to prompt the user to check in; otherwise, the room will be
--   released.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRequireCheckIn</a> smart constructor.
data CreateRequireCheckIn
CreateRequireCheckIn' :: Int -> Bool -> CreateRequireCheckIn

--   AVS device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
newMeetingRoomConfiguration :: MeetingRoomConfiguration

-- | The values that indicate whether a pin is always required (YES), never
--   required (NO), or OPTIONAL.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If YES, Alexa will always ask for a meeting pin.</li>
--   <li>If NO, Alexa will never ask for a meeting pin.</li>
--   <li>If OPTIONAL, Alexa will ask if you have a meeting pin and if the
--   customer responds with yes, it will ask for the meeting pin.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMeetingSetting</a> smart constructor.
data MeetingSetting
MeetingSetting' :: RequirePin -> MeetingSetting

-- | Create a value of <a>MeetingSetting</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requirePin:MeetingSetting'</a>,
--   <a>meetingSetting_requirePin</a> - The values that indicate whether
--   the pin is always required.
newMeetingSetting :: RequirePin -> MeetingSetting

-- | The network profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkProfile</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkProfile
NetworkProfile' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe NetworkEapMethod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkSecurityType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkProfile

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_certificateAuthorityArn</a> - The ARN of the Private
--   Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).
--   This is used to issue certificates to the devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trustAnchors:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_trustAnchors</a> - The root certificates of your
--   authentication server, which is installed on your devices and used to
--   trust your authentication server during EAP negotiation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentPassword:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_currentPassword</a> - The current password of the
--   Wi-Fi network.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eapMethod:NetworkProfile'</a>, <a>networkProfile_eapMethod</a>
--   - The authentication standard that is used in the EAP framework.
--   Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileName:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_networkProfileName</a> - The name of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_description</a> - Detailed information about a
--   device's network profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityType:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_securityType</a> - The security type of the Wi-Fi
--   network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE, WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or OPEN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPassword:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_nextPassword</a> - The next, or subsequent, password
--   of the Wi-Fi network. This password is asynchronously transmitted to
--   the device and is used when the password of the network changes to
--   NextPassword.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileArn:NetworkProfile'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfile_networkProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ssid:NetworkProfile'</a>, <a>networkProfile_ssid</a> - The
--   SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
newNetworkProfile :: NetworkProfile

-- | The data associated with a network profile.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkProfileData</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkProfileData
NetworkProfileData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkEapMethod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkSecurityType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkProfileData

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkProfileData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateAuthorityArn:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_certificateAuthorityArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS Certificate Manager
--   (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eapMethod:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_eapMethod</a> - The authentication standard that
--   is used in the EAP framework. Currently, EAP_TLS is supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileName:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_networkProfileName</a> - The name of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_description</a> - Detailed information about a
--   device's network profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityType:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_securityType</a> - The security type of the
--   Wi-Fi network. This can be WPA2_ENTERPRISE, WPA2_PSK, WPA_PSK, WEP, or
--   OPEN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkProfileArn:NetworkProfileData'</a>,
--   <a>networkProfileData_networkProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the network
--   profile associated with a device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ssid:NetworkProfileData'</a>, <a>networkProfileData_ssid</a> -
--   The SSID of the Wi-Fi network.
newNetworkProfileData :: NetworkProfileData

-- | The information for public switched telephone network (PSTN)
--   conferencing.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPSTNDialIn</a> smart constructor.
data PSTNDialIn
PSTNDialIn' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PSTNDialIn

-- | Create a value of <a>PSTNDialIn</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:countryCode:PSTNDialIn'</a>, <a>pSTNDialIn_countryCode</a> -
--   The zip code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:PSTNDialIn'</a>, <a>pSTNDialIn_phoneNumber</a> -
--   The phone number to call to join the conference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oneClickIdDelay:PSTNDialIn'</a>,
--   <a>pSTNDialIn_oneClickIdDelay</a> - The delay duration before Alexa
--   enters the conference ID with dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each
--   number on the dial pad corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we
--   send data over the telephone network.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oneClickPinDelay:PSTNDialIn'</a>,
--   <a>pSTNDialIn_oneClickPinDelay</a> - The delay duration before Alexa
--   enters the conference pin with dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF). Each
--   number on the dial pad corresponds to a DTMF tone, which is how we
--   send data over the telephone network.
newPSTNDialIn :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PSTNDialIn

--   message in the correct SSML format. The audio tag is not supported.

--   case-sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value of a tag. Tag
--   values are case sensitive and can be null.

-- | Settings for the end of meeting reminder feature that are applied to a
--   room profile. The end of meeting reminder enables Alexa to remind
--   users when a meeting is ending.
--

-- | Updates settings for the instant booking feature that are applied to a
--   room profile. If instant booking is enabled, Alexa automatically
--   reserves a room if it is free when a user joins a meeting with Alexa.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateInstantBooking</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateInstantBooking
UpdateInstantBooking' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> UpdateInstantBooking

--   and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that determines how long to book
--   an available room when a meeting is started with Alexa.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:UpdateInstantBooking'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstantBooking_enabled</a> - Whether instant booking is
--   enabled or not.
newUpdateInstantBooking :: UpdateInstantBooking

--   device, or by saying â€œAlexa, check in.â€
